   20: 
   21: -module(port_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: %%%
   24: %%% Author: Bjorn Gustavsson; iter_max_ports contributed by Peter Hogfeldt.
   25: %%%
   26: 
   27: %%
   28: %% There are a lot of things to test with open_port(Name, Settings).
   29: %%
   30: %%   Name can be
   31: %%
   32: %%       {spawn, Command}
   33: %%         which according to The Book and the manual page starts an
   34: %%         external program. That is not true. It might very well be
   35: %%         a linked-in program (the notion of 'linked-in driver' is
   36: %%         silly, since any driver is 'linked-in').
   37: %%	       [Spawn of external program is tested.]
   38: %%
   39: %%       {fd, In, Out}
   40: %%         Open file descriptors In and Out. [Not tested]
   41: %%
   42: %%   PortSettings can be
   43: %%
   44: %%       {packet, N}
   45: %%         N is 1, 2 or 4.
   46: %%
   47: %%       stream (default)
   48: %%         Without packet length.
   49: %%
   50: %%       use_stdio (default for spawned ports)
   51: %%         The spawned process use file descriptors 0 and 1 for I/O.
   52: %%
   53: %%       nouse_stdio					[Not tested]
   54: %%         Use filedescriptors 3 and 4.  This option is probably only
   55: %%	   meaningful on Unix.
   56: %%
   57: %%       in (default for Atom)
   58: %%         Input only (from Erlang's point of view).
   59: %%
   60: %%       out
   61: %%         Output only (from Erlang's point of view).
   62: %%
   63: %%       binary
   64: %%         The port is a binary port, i.e. messages received and sent
   65: %%         to a port are binaries.
   66: %%
   67: %%       eof
   68: %%         Port is not closed on eof and will not send an exit signal,
   69: %%         instead it will send a {Port, eof} to the controlling process
   70: %%         (output can still be sent to the port (??)).
   71: %%
   72: 
   73: 
   74: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   75:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   76: -export([
   77:     badarg_port_with_atom/1,
   78:     bad_args/1,
   79:     bad_env/1,
   80:     bad_packet/1,

   82:     basic_ping/1,
   83:     cd/1,
   84:     cd_relative/1,
   85:     close_deaf_port/1,
   86:     count_fds/1,
   87:     dropped_commands/1,
   88:     dying_port/1,
   89:     env/1,
   90:     eof/1,
   91:     exit_status/1,
   92:     exit_status_multi_scheduling_block/1,
   93:     huge_env/1,

   99:     mon_port_invalid_type/1,
  100:     mon_port_bad_named/1,
  101:     mon_port_bad_remote_on_local/1,
  102:     mon_port_local/1,
  103:     mon_port_name_demonitor/1,
  104:     mon_port_named/1,
  105:     mon_port_origin_dies/1,
  106:     mon_port_owner_dies/1,
  107:     mon_port_pid_demonitor/1,
  108:     mon_port_remote_on_remote/1,
  109:     mon_port_driver_die/1,
  110:     mon_port_down_sig/1,
  111:     mul_basic/1,

  138: ]).

  141:          port_exit_demonitor_race/1,

  166: suite() ->
  167:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  168:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
  169:

  171:     [otp_6224, {group, stream}, basic_ping, slow_writes,
  172:      bad_packet, bad_port_messages, {group, options},
  173:      {group, multiple_packets}, parallell, dying_port, dropped_commands,
  174:      port_program_with_path, name1, env, huge_env, bad_env, cd,
  175:      cd_relative, pipe_limit_env, bad_args, badarg_port_with_atom,

  186:      mon_port_bad_remote_on_local,
  187:      mon_port_origin_dies,

  189:      mon_port_named,
  190:      mon_port_bad_named,
  191:      mon_port_pid_demonitor,
  192:      mon_port_name_demonitor,
  193:      mon_port_driver_die,
  194:      mon_port_down_sig,
  195:      {group, port_exit_signal_race}].
  196: 
  197: groups() ->
  198:     [{stream, [], [stream_small, stream_big]},
  199:      {options, [], [t_binary, eof, input_only, output_only]},
  200:      {multiple_packets, [], [mul_basic, mul_slow_writes]},
  201:      {tps, [], [tps_16_bytes, tps_1K]},
  202:      {port_exit_signal_race, [], [port_exit_monitor_race,
  203:                                   port_exit_demonitor_race,
  204:                                   port_exit_link_race,
  205:                                   port_exit_unlink_race,
  206:                                   port_exit_command_race,
  207:                                   port_exit_connect_race,
  208:                                   port_exit_close_race,
  209:                                   port_exit_exit_race,
  210:                                   port_exit_command_request_race,
  211:                                   port_exit_connect_request_race,
  212:                                   port_exit_close_request_race,
  213:                                   port_exit_control_request_race,
  214:                                   port_exit_call_request_race,
  215:                                   port_exit_info_request_race]}].
  216: 
  217: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when Case =:= mon_port_driver_die;
  218:                                      Case =:= mon_port_driver_die_demonitor ->
  219:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  220:         1 -> {skip, "Need 2 schedulers to run testcase"};
  221:         _ -> Config
  222:     end;
  223: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
  224:     [{testcase, Case} |Config].
  225: 
  226: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  227:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
  228: 
  229: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  230:     ignore_cores:init(Config).
  231: 
  232: end_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  233:     ignore_cores:fini(Config).
  234: 
  235: 
  236: -define(WIN_MASSIVE_PORT, 50000).
  237: 
  238: %% Tests that you can open a massive amount of ports (sockets)
  239: %% on a Windows machine given the correct environment.
  240: win_massive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  241:     case os:type() of
  242:         {win32,_} ->
  243:             do_win_massive();
  244:         _ ->
  245:             {skip,"Only on Windows."}
  246:     end.
  247: 
  248: do_win_massive() ->
  249:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 6}),
  250:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+Q", "8192"]),
  251:     ok = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,win_massive_client,[3000]),
  252:     peer:stop(Peer).
  253: 
  254: win_massive_client(N) ->
  255:     {ok,P}=gen_tcp:listen(?WIN_MASSIVE_PORT,[{reuseaddr,true}]),
  256:     L = win_massive_loop(P,N),
  257:     Len = length(L),
  258:     lists:foreach(fun(E) ->
  259:                           gen_tcp:close(E)
  260:                   end,
  261:                   L),
  262:     case Len div 2 of
  263:         N ->
  264:             ok;
  265:         _Else ->
  266:             {too_few, Len}
  267:     end.
  268: 
  269: win_massive_loop(_,0) ->
  270:     [];
  271: win_massive_loop(P,N) ->
  272:     case (catch gen_tcp:connect("localhost",?WIN_MASSIVE_PORT,[])) of
  273:         {ok,A} ->
  274:             case (catch gen_tcp:accept(P)) of
  275:                 {ok,B} ->
  276:                     %erlang:display(N),
  277:                     [A,B|win_massive_loop(P,N-1)];
  278:                 _Else ->
  279:                     [A]
  280:             end;
  281:         _Else0 ->
  282:             []
  283:     end.
  284: 
  285: 
  286: %% Test that we can send a stream of bytes and get it back.
  287: %% We will send only a small amount of data, to avoid deadlock.
  288: 
  289: stream_small(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  290:     stream_ping(Config, 512, "", []),
  291:     stream_ping(Config, 1777, "", []),
  292:     stream_ping(Config, 1777, "-s512", []),
  293:     ok.
  294: 
  295: %% Send big amounts of data (much bigger than the buffer size in port test).
  296: %% This will deadlock the emulator if the spawn driver haven't proper
  297: %% non-blocking reads and writes.
  298: 
  299: stream_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  300:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 180}),
  301:     stream_ping(Config, 43755, "", []),
  302:     stream_ping(Config, 100000, "", []),
  303:     stream_ping(Config, 77777, " -s40000", []),
  304:     ok.
  305: 
  306: %% Sends packet with header size of 1, 2, and 4, with packets of various
  307: %% sizes.
  308: 
  309: basic_ping(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  310:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  311:     ping(Config, sizes(1), 1, "", []),
  312:     ping(Config, sizes(2), 2, "", []),
  313:     ping(Config, sizes(4), 4, "", []),
  314:     ok.
  315: 
  316: %% Let the port program insert delays between characters sent back to
  317: %% Erlang, to test that the Erlang emulator can handle a packet coming in
  318: %% small chunks rather than all at once.
  319: 
  320: slow_writes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  321:     ping(Config, [8], 4, "-s1", []),
  322:     ping(Config, [10], 2, "-s2", []),
  323:     ok.
  324: 
  325: %% Test that we get {'EXIT', Port, einval} if we try to send a bigger
  326: %% packet than the packet header allows.
  327: bad_packet(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  328:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  329:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  330: 
  331:     bad_packet(PortTest, 1, 256),
  332:     bad_packet(PortTest, 1, 257),
  333:     bad_packet(PortTest, 2, 65536),
  334:     bad_packet(PortTest, 2, 65537),
  335:     ok.
  336: 
  337: bad_packet(PortTest, HeaderSize, PacketSize) ->
  338:     P = open_port({spawn, PortTest}, [{packet, HeaderSize}]),
  339:     P ! {self(), {command, make_zero_packet(PacketSize)}},
  340:     receive
  341:         {'EXIT', P, einval} -> ok;
  342:         Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_message, Other})
  343:     end.
  344: 
  345: make_zero_packet(0) -> [];
  346: make_zero_packet(N) when N rem 2 == 0 ->
  347:     P = make_zero_packet(N div 2),
  348:     [P|P];
  349: make_zero_packet(N) ->
  350:     P = make_zero_packet(N div 2),
  351:     [0, P|P].
  352: 
  353: %% Test sending bad messages to a port.
  354: bad_port_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  355:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  356:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  357: 
  358:     bad_message(PortTest, {a,b}),
  359:     bad_message(PortTest, {a}),
  360:     bad_message(PortTest, {self(),{command,bad_command}}),
  361:     bad_message(PortTest, {self(),{connect,no_pid}}),
  362:     ok.
  363: 
  364: bad_message(PortTest, Message) ->
  365:     P = open_port({spawn,PortTest}, []),
  366:     P ! Message,
  367:     receive
  368:         {'EXIT',P,badsig} -> ok;
  369:         Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_message, Other})
  370:     end.
  371: 
  372: %% Tests various options (stream and {packet, Number} are implicitly
  373: %% tested in other test cases).
  374: 
  375: 
  376: %% Tests the 'binary' option for a port.
  377: 
  378: t_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  379:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 300}),
  380: 
  381:     %% Packet mode.
  382:     ping(Config, sizes(1), 1, "", [binary]),
  383:     ping(Config, sizes(2), 2, "", [binary]),
  384:     ping(Config, sizes(4), 4, "", [binary]),
  385: 
  386:     %% Stream mode.
  387:     stream_ping(Config, 435, "", [binary]),
  388:     stream_ping(Config, 43755, "", [binary]),
  389:     stream_ping(Config, 100000, "", [binary]),
  390:     ok.
  391: 
  392: name1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  393:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 100}),
  394:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  395:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " "]),
  396:     P = open_port({spawn, Command}, []),
  397:     register(myport, P),
  398:     P = whereis(myport),
  399:     Text = "hej",
  400:     myport ! {self(), {command, Text}},
  401:     receive
  402:         {P, {data, Text}} ->
  403:             ok
  404:     end,
  405:     myport ! {self(), close},
  406:     receive
  407:         {P, closed} -> ok
  408:     end,
  409:     undefined = whereis(myport),
  410:     ok.
  411: 
  412: %% Test that the 'eof' option works.
  413: 
  414: eof(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  415:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 100}),
  416:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  417:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " -h0 -q"]),
  418:     P = open_port({spawn, Command}, [eof]),
  419:     receive
  420:         {P, eof} ->
  421:             ok
  422:     end,
  423:     P ! {self(), close},
  424:     receive
  425:         {P, closed} -> ok
  426:     end,
  427:     ok.
  428: 
  429: %% Tests that the 'in' option for a port works.
  430: 
  431: input_only(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  432:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 300}),
  433:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 128, 255], 1, "", [in]),
  434:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 255, 2048], 2, "", [in]),
  435:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 255, 2048], 4, "", [in]),
  436:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 128, 255],
  437:                  1, "", [in, binary]),
  438:     ok.
  439: 
  440: %% Tests that the 'out' option for a port works.
  441: 
  442: output_only(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  443:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 100}),
  444:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  445: 
  446:     %% First we test that the port program gets the data
  447:     Filename = filename:join(Dir, "output_only_stream"),
  448:     Data = random_packet(35777, "echo"),
  449:     output_and_verify(Config, ["-h0 -o", Filename], Data),
  450:     Wait_time = 500,
  451:     test_server:sleep(Wait_time),
  452:     {ok, Written} = file:read_file(Filename),
  453:     Data = binary_to_list(Written),
  454: 
  455:     %% Then we test that any writes to stdout from
  456:     %% the port program is not sent to erlang
  457:     output_and_verify(Config, ["-h0"], Data),
  458:     ok.
  459: 
  460: output_and_verify(Config, Options, Data) ->
  461:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  462:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " " | Options]),
  463:     Port = open_port({spawn, Command}, [out]),
  464:     Port ! {self(), {command, Data}},
  465:     Port ! {self(), close},
  466:     receive
  467:         {Port, closed} -> ok;
  468:         Msg -> ct:fail({received_unexpected_message, Msg})
  469:     end.
  470: 
  471: %% Test that receiving several packages written in the same
  472: %% write operation works.
  473: 
  474: 
  475: %% Basic test of receiving multiple packages, written in
  476: %% one operation by the other end.
  477: mul_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  478:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 10}),
  479:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 255, 10, 13], 1, "", []),
  480:     expect_input(Config, [0, 10, 13, 1600, 32767, 65535], 2, "", []),
  481:     expect_input(Config, [10, 70000], 4, "", []),
  482:     ok.
  483: 
  484: %% Test reading a buffer consisting of several packets, some
  485: %% of which might be incomplete.  (The port program builds
  486: %% a buffer with several packets, but writes it in chunks with
  487: %% delays in between.)
  488: 
  489: mul_slow_writes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  490:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 4}),
  491:     expect_input(Config, [0, 20, 255, 10, 1], 1, "-s64", []),
  492:     ok.
  493: 
  494: %% Runs several port tests in parallell.  Each individual test
  495: %% finishes in about 5 seconds.  Running in parallell, all tests
  496: %% should also finish in about 5 seconds.
  497: 
  498: parallell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  499:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 5}),
  500:     Testers = [
  501:                fun() -> stream_ping(Config, 1007, "-s100", []) end,
  502:                fun() -> stream_ping(Config, 10007, "-s1000", []) end,
  503:                fun() -> stream_ping(Config, 10007, "-s1000", []) end,
  504: 
  505:                fun() -> expect_input(Config, [21, 22, 23, 24, 25], 1,
  506:                                      "-s10", [in]) end,
  507: 
  508:                fun() -> ping(Config, [10], 1, "-d", []) end,
  509:                fun() -> ping(Config, [20000], 2, "-d", []) end,
  510:                fun() -> ping(Config, [101], 1, "-s10", []) end,
  511:                fun() -> ping(Config, [1001], 2, "-s100", []) end,
  512:                fun() -> ping(Config, [10001], 4, "-s1000", []) end,
  513: 
  514:                fun() -> ping(Config, [501, 501], 2, "-s100", []) end,
  515:                fun() -> ping(Config, [11, 12, 13, 14, 11], 1, "-s5", []) end],
  516:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  517:     Pids = lists:map(fun fun_spawn/1, Testers),
  518:     wait_for(Pids),
  519:     ok.
  520: 
  521: wait_for([]) ->
  522:     ok;
  523: wait_for(Pids) ->
  524:     io:format("Waiting for ~p", [Pids]),
  525:     receive
  526:         {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
  527:             wait_for(lists:delete(Pid, Pids));
  528:         Other ->
  529:             ct:fail({bad_exit, Other})
  530:     end.
  531: 
  532: %% Tests starting port programs that terminate by themselves.
  533: %% This used to cause problems on Windows.
  534: 
  535: dying_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  536:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  537:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  538: 
  539:     P1 = make_dying_port(Config),
  540:     P2 = make_dying_port(Config),
  541:     P3 = make_dying_port(Config),
  542:     P4 = make_dying_port(Config),
  543:     P5 = make_dying_port(Config),
  544: 
  545:     %% This should be big enough to be sure to block in the write.
  546:     Garbage = random_packet(16384),
  547: 
  548:     P1 ! {self(), {command, Garbage}},
  549:     P3 ! {self(), {command, Garbage}},
  550:     P5 ! {self(), {command, Garbage}},
  551: 
  552:     wait_for_port_exit(P1),
  553:     wait_for_port_exit(P2),
  554:     wait_for_port_exit(P3),
  555:     wait_for_port_exit(P4),
  556:     wait_for_port_exit(P5),
  557:     ok.
  558: 
  559: wait_for_port_exit(Port) ->
  560:     receive
  561:         {'EXIT', Port, _} ->
  562:             ok
  563:     end.
  564: 
  565: make_dying_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  566:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  567:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " -h0 -d -q"]),
  568:     open_port({spawn, Command}, [stream]).
  569: 
  570: %% Test that dropped port_commands work correctly.
  571: %% This used to cause a segfault.
  572: %%
  573: %% This testcase creates a port and then lets many processes
  574: %% do parallel commands to it. After a while it closes the
  575: %% port and we are trying to catch the race when doing a
  576: %% command while the port is closing.
  577: dropped_commands(Config) ->
  578:     %% Test with output callback
  579:     dropped_commands(Config, false, {self(), {command, "1"}}),
  580:     %% Test with outputv callback
  581:     dropped_commands(Config, true, {self(), {command, "1"}}).
  582: 
  583: dropped_commands(Config, Outputv, Cmd) ->
  584:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  585:     os:putenv("ECHO_DRV_USE_OUTPUTV", atom_to_list(Outputv)),
  586:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
  587:     [dropped_commands_test(Cmd) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 100)],
  588:     timer:sleep(100),
  589:     erl_ddll:unload_driver("echo_drv"),
  590:     os:unsetenv("ECHO_DRV_USE_OUTPUTV"),
  591:     ok.
  592: 
  593: dropped_commands_test(Cmd) ->
  594:     spawn_monitor(
  595:       fun() ->
  596:               Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"},
  597:                                       [{parallelism, true}]),
  598:               [spawn_link(fun() -> spin(Port, Cmd) end) || _ <- lists:seq(1,8)],
  599:               timer:sleep(5),
  600:               port_close(Port),
  601:               timer:sleep(5),
  602:               exit(nok)
  603:       end),
  604:     receive _M -> timer:sleep(5) end.
  605: 
  606: spin(P, Cmd) ->
  607:     P ! Cmd,
  608:     spin(P, Cmd).
  609: 
  610: 
  611: %% Tests that port program with complete path (but without any
  612: %% .exe extension) can be started, even if there is a file with
  613: %% the same name but without the extension in the same directory.
  614: %% (In practice, the file with the same name could be a Unix
  615: %% executable.)
  616: %%
  617: %% This used to failed on Windows (the .exe extension had to be
  618: %% explicitly given).
  619: %%
  620: %% This testcase works on Unix, but is not very useful.
  621: 
  622: port_program_with_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  623:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  624:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  625:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  626: 
  627:     %% Create a copy of the port test program in a directory not
  628:     %% included in PATH (i.e. in priv_dir), with the name 'my_port_test.exe'.
  629:     %% Also, place a file named 'my_port_test' in the same directory.
  630:     %% This used to confuse the CreateProcess() call in spawn driver.
  631:     %% (On Unix, there will be a single file created, which will be
  632:     %% a copy of the port program.)
  633: 
  634:     PortTest = os:find_executable("port_test", DataDir),
  635:     io:format("os:find_executable(~p, ~p) returned ~p",
  636:               ["port_test", DataDir, PortTest]),
  637:     {ok, PortTestPgm} = file:read_file(PortTest),
  638:     NewName = filename:join(PrivDir, filename:basename(PortTest)),
  639:     RedHerring = filename:rootname(NewName),
  640:     ok = file:write_file(RedHerring, "I'm just here to confuse.\n"),
  641:     ok = file:write_file(NewName, PortTestPgm),
  642:     ok = file:write_file_info(NewName, #file_info{mode=8#111}),
  643:     PgmWithPathAndNoExt = filename:rootname(NewName),
  644: 
  645:     %% Open the port using the path to the copied port test program,
  646:     %% but without the .exe extension, and verified that it was started.
  647:     %%
  648:     %% If the bug is present the open_port call will fail with badarg.
  649: 
  650:     Command = lists:concat([PgmWithPathAndNoExt, " -h2"]),
  651:     P = open_port({spawn, Command}, [{packet, 2}]),
  652:     Message = "echo back to me",
  653:     P ! {self(), {command, Message}},
  654:     receive
  655:         {P, {data, Message}} ->
  656:             ok
  657:     end,
  658:     ok.
  659: 
  660: %% Tests that ports can no longer be opened using atoms
  661: badarg_port_with_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  662:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  663:     File = filename:join(PrivDir, "port_file"),
  664:     case catch open_port(File, [eof]) of
  665:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  666:             ok
  667:     end,
  668: 
  669:     case catch open_port(atom_port, [eof]) of
  670:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  671:             ok
  672:     end,
  673:     ok.
  674: 
  675: %% Tests that all appropriate fd's have been closed in the port program
  676: count_fds(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  677:     case os:type() of
  678:         {unix, _} ->
  679:             PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  680:             Filename = filename:join(PrivDir, "my_fd_counter"),
  681: 
  682:             RunTest = fun(PortOpts) ->
  683:                               PortTest = port_test(Config),
  684:                               Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " -n -f -o", Filename]),
  685:                               Port = open_port({spawn, Command}, PortOpts),
  686:                               Port ! {self(), close},
  687:                               receive
  688:                                   {Port, closed} -> ok
  689:                               end,
  690:                               test_server:sleep(500),
  691:                               {ok, Written} = file:read_file(Filename),
  692:                               Written
  693:                       end,
  694:             <<4:32/native>> = RunTest([out, nouse_stdio]),
  695:             <<4:32/native>> = RunTest([in, nouse_stdio]),
  696:             <<5:32/native>> = RunTest([in, out, nouse_stdio]),
  697:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([out, use_stdio]),
  698:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([in, use_stdio]),
  699:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([in, out, use_stdio]),
  700:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([in, out, use_stdio, stderr_to_stdout]),
  701:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([out, use_stdio, stderr_to_stdout]);
  702:         _ ->
  703:             {skip, "Skipped on windows"}
  704:     end.
  705: 
  706: %%
  707: %% Open as many ports as possible. Do this several times and check
  708: %% that we get the same number of ports every time.
  709: %%
  710: 
  711: iter_max_ports(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  712:     %% The child_setup program might dump core if we get out of memory.
  713:     %% This is hard to do anything about and is harmless. We run this test
  714:     %% in a working directory with an ignore_core_files file which will make
  715:     %% the search for core files ignore cores generated by this test.
  716:     %%
  717:     Config2 = ignore_cores:setup(?MODULE, iter_max_ports, Config, true),
  718:     try
  719:         iter_max_ports_test(Config2)
  720:     after
  721:         ignore_cores:restore(Config2)
  722:     end.
  723: 
  724: 
  725: iter_max_ports_test(Config) ->
  726:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 30}),
  727:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  728:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " -h0 -q"]),
  729:     Iters = case os:type() of
  730:                 {win32,_} -> 4;
  731:                 _ -> 10
  732:             end,
  733:     %% Run on a different node in order to limit the effect if this test fails.
  734:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+Q", "2048"]),
  735:     L = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,do_iter_max_ports,[Iters, Command]),
  736:     peer:stop(Peer),
  737: 
  738:     ct:log("Result: ~p",[L]),
  739:     all_equal(L),
  740:     all_equal(L),
  741:     {comment, "Max ports: " ++ integer_to_list(hd(L))}.
  742: 
  743: do_iter_max_ports(N, Command) when N > 0 ->
  744:     [max_ports(Command)| do_iter_max_ports(N-1, Command)];
  745: do_iter_max_ports(_, _) ->
  746:     [].
  747: 
  748: all_equal([E,E|T]) ->
  749:     all_equal([E|T]);
  750: all_equal([_]) -> ok;
  751: all_equal([]) -> ok.
  752: 
  753: max_ports(Command) ->
  754:     test_server:sleep(500),
  755:     Ps = open_ports({spawn, Command}, [eof]),
  756:     N = length(Ps),
  757:     close_ports(Ps),
  758:     io:format("Got ~p ports\n",[N]),
  759:     N.
  760: 
  761: close_ports([P|Ps]) ->
  762:     P ! {self(), close},
  763:     receive
  764:         {P,closed} ->
  765:             ok
  766:     end,
  767:     close_ports(Ps);
  768: close_ports([]) ->
  769:     ok.
  770: 
  771: open_ports(Name, Settings) ->
  772:     case os:type() of
  773:         {unix, freebsd} ->
  774:             %% FreeBsd has issues with sendmsg/recvmsg in fork
  775:             %% implementation and we therefore have to spawn
  776:             %% slower to make sure that we always hit the same
  777:             %% make roof.
  778:             test_server:sleep(10);
  779:         _ ->
  780:             test_server:sleep(5)
  781:     end,
  782:     case catch open_port(Name, Settings) of
  783:         P when is_port(P) ->
  784:             [P| open_ports(Name, Settings)];
  785:         {'EXIT', {Code, _}} ->
  786:             case Code of
  787:                 enfile ->
  788:                     [];
  789:                 emfile ->
  790:                     [];
  791:                 system_limit ->
  792:                     [];
  793:                 enomem ->
  794:                     [];
  795:                 Other ->
  796:                     ct:fail({open_ports, Other})
  797:             end;
  798:         Other ->
  799:             ct:fail({open_ports, Other})
  800:     end.
  801: 
  802: %% Tests that exit(Port, Term) works (has been known to crash the emulator).
  803: 
  804: t_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  805:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  806:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun suicide_port/1, [Config]),
  807:     receive
  808:         {'EXIT', Pid, die} ->
  809:             ok;
  810:         Other ->
  811:             ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  812:     end.
  813: 
  814: suicide_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  815:     Port = port_expect(Config, [], 0, "", []),
  816:     exit(Port, die),
  817:     receive after infinity -> ok end.
  818: 
  819: 
  820: tps_16_bytes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  821:     tps(16, Config).
  822: 
  823: tps_1K(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  824:     tps(1024, Config).
  825: 
  826: tps(Size, Config) ->
  827:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 5}),
  828:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  829:     Packet = list_to_binary(random_packet(Size, "e")),
  830:     Port = open_port({spawn, PortTest}, [binary, {packet, 2}]),
  831:     Transactions = 10000,
  832:     {Elapsed, ok} = test_server:timecall(?MODULE, tps,
  833:                                          [Port, Packet, Transactions]),
  834:     {comment, integer_to_list(trunc(Transactions/Elapsed+0.5)) ++ " transactions/s"}.
  835: 
  836: tps(_Port, _Packet, 0) -> ok;
  837: tps(Port, Packet, N) ->
  838:     port_command(Port, Packet),
  839:     receive
  840:         {Port, {data, Packet}} ->
  841:             tps(Port, Packet, N-1);
  842:         Other ->
  843:             ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  844:     end.
  845: 
  846: %% Line I/O test
  847: line(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  848:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 5}),
  849:     Siz = 110,
  850:     Packet1 = random_packet(Siz),
  851:     Packet2 = random_packet(Siz div 2),
  852:     %% Test that packets are split into lines
  853:     port_expect(Config,[{lists:append([Packet1, io_lib:nl(), Packet2,
  854:                                        io_lib:nl()]),
  855:                          [{eol, Packet1}, {eol, Packet2}]}],
  856:                 0, "", [{line,Siz}]),
  857:     %% Test the same for binaries
  858:     port_expect(Config,[{lists:append([Packet1, io_lib:nl(), Packet2,
  859:                                        io_lib:nl()]),
  860:                          [{eol, Packet1}, {eol, Packet2}]}],
  861:                 0, "", [{line,Siz},binary]),
  862:     %% Test that too long lines get split
  863:     port_expect(Config,[{lists:append([Packet1, io_lib:nl(), Packet1,
  864:                                        Packet2, io_lib:nl()]),
  865:                          [{eol, Packet1}, {noeol, Packet1},
  866:                           {eol, Packet2}]}], 0, "", [{line,Siz}]),
  867:     %% Test that last output from closing port program gets received.
  868:     L1 = lists:append([Packet1, io_lib:nl(), Packet2]),
  869:     S1 = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("-l~w", [length(L1)])),
  870:     io:format("S1 = ~w, L1 = ~w~n", [S1,L1]),
  871:     port_expect(Config,[{L1,
  872:                          [{eol, Packet1}, {noeol, Packet2}, eof]}], 0,
  873:                 S1, [{line,Siz},eof]),
  874:     %% Test that lonely <CR> Don't get treated as newlines
  875:     port_expect(Config,[{lists:append([Packet1, [13], Packet2,
  876:                                        io_lib:nl()]),
  877:                          [{noeol, Packet1}, {eol, [13 |Packet2]}]}],
  878:                 0, "", [{line,Siz}]),
  879:     %% Test that packets get built up to lines (delayed output from
  880:     %% port program)
  881:     port_expect(Config,[{Packet2,[]},
  882:                         {lists:append([Packet2, io_lib:nl(),
  883:                                        Packet1, io_lib:nl()]),
  884:                          [{eol, lists:append(Packet2, Packet2)},
  885:                           {eol, Packet1}]}], 0, "-d", [{line,Siz}]),
  886:     %% Test that we get badarg if trying both packet and line
  887:     bad_argument(Config, [{packet, 5}, {line, 5}]),
  888:     ok.
  889: 
  890: %% Test that redirection of standard error to standard output works.
  891: stderr_to_stdout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  892:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 1}),
  893:     %% See that it works
  894:     Packet = random_packet(10),
  895:     port_expect(Config,[{Packet,[Packet]}], 0, "-e -l10",
  896:                 [stderr_to_stdout]),
  897:     %% stream_ping(Config, 10, "-e", [stderr_to_stdout]),
  898:     %% See that it doesn't always happen (will generate garbage on stderr)
  899:     port_expect(Config,[{Packet,[eof]}], 0, "-e -l10", [line,eof]),
  900:     ok.
  901: 
  902: 
  903: bad_argument(Config, ArgList) ->
  904:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  905:     case catch open_port({spawn, PortTest}, ArgList) of
  906:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  907:             ok
  908:     end.
  909: 
  910: 
  911: %% 'env' option
  912: %% (Can perhaps be made smaller by calling the other utility functions
  913: %% in this module.)
  914: %%
  915: %% Test that the 'env' option works
  916: env(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
  917:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 1}),
  918:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  919:     Temp = filename:join(Priv, "env_fun.bin"),
  920: 
  921:     PluppVal = "dirty monkey",
  922:     env_slave(Temp, [{"plupp",PluppVal}]),
  923: 
  924:     Long = "LongAndBoringEnvName",
  925:     os:putenv(Long, "nisse"),
  926: 
  927:     env_slave(Temp, [{"plupp",PluppVal},
  928:                      {"DIR_PLUPP","###glurfrik"}],
  929:               fun() ->
  930:                       PluppVal = os:getenv("plupp"),
  931:                       "###glurfrik" = os:getenv("DIR_PLUPP"),
  932:                       "nisse" = os:getenv(Long)
  933:               end),
  934: 
  935: 
  936:     env_slave(Temp, [{"must_define_something","some_value"},
  937:                      {"certainly_not_existing",false},
  938:                      {"ends_with_equal", "value="},
  939:                      {Long,false},
  940:                      {"glurf","a glorfy string"}]),
  941: 
  942:     %% A lot of non existing variables (mingled with existing)
  943:     NotExistingList = [{lists:flatten(io_lib:format("V~p_not_existing",[X])),false}
  944:                        ||  X <- lists:seq(1,150)],
  945:     ExistingList = [{lists:flatten(io_lib:format("V~p_existing",[X])),"a_value"}
  946:                     ||  X <- lists:seq(1,150)],
  947:     env_slave(Temp, lists:sort(ExistingList ++ NotExistingList)),
  948:     ok.
  949: 
  950: env_slave(File, Env) ->
  951:     F = fun() ->
  952:                 lists:foreach(fun({Name,Val}) ->
  953:                                       Val = os:getenv(Name)
  954:                               end, Env)
  955:         end,
  956:     env_slave(File, Env, F).
  957: 
  958: env_slave(File, Env, Body) ->
  959:     file:write_file(File, term_to_binary(Body)),
  960:     Program = ct:get_progname(),
  961:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  962:     Cmd = Program ++ " -pz " ++ Dir ++
  963:     " -noinput -run " ++ ?MODULE_STRING ++ " env_slave_main " ++
  964:     File ++ " -run erlang halt",
  965:     Port = open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [{env,Env},{line,256}]),
  966:     receive
  967:         {Port,{data,{eol,"ok"}}} ->
  968:             ok;
  969:         {Port,{data,{eol,Error}}} ->
  970:             ct:fail("eol error ~p\n", [Error]);
  971:         Other ->
  972:             ct:fail(Other)
  973:     end.
  974: 
  975: env_slave_main([File]) ->
  976:     {ok,Body0} = file:read_file(File),
  977:     Body = binary_to_term(Body0),
  978:     case Body() of
  979:         {'EXIT',Reason} ->
  980:             io:format("Error: ~p\n", [Reason]);
  981:         _ ->
  982:             io:format("ok\n")
  983:     end,
  984:     init:stop().
  985: 
  986: 
  987: %% 'env' option
  988: %%   Test bad environments.
  989: bad_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  990:     try_bad_env([abbb]),
  991:     try_bad_env([{"key","value"}|{"another","value"}]),
  992:     try_bad_env([{"key","value","value2"}]),
  993:     try_bad_env([{"key",[a,b,c]}]),
  994:     try_bad_env([{"key",value}]),
  995:     try_bad_env({a,tuple}),
  996:     try_bad_env(42),
  997:     try_bad_env([a|b]),
  998:     try_bad_env(self()),
  999:     ok.
 1000: 
 1001: try_bad_env(Env) ->
 1002:     badarg = try open_port({spawn,"ls"}, [{env,Env}])
 1003: 	     catch
 1004: 		 error:badarg -> badarg
 1005: 	     end.
 1006: 
 1007: 
 1008: %% Test that we can handle a very very large environment gracefully.
 1009: huge_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1010:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
 1011:     {Vars, Cmd} = case os:type() of
 1012:                       {win32,_} -> {500, "cmd /q /c ls"};
 1013:                       _ ->
 1014:                           %% We create a huge environment,
 1015:                           %% 20000 variables is about 25MB
 1016:                           %% which seems to be the limit on Linux.
 1017:                           {20000, "ls"}
 1018:                   end,
 1019:     Env = [{[$a + I div (25*25*25*25) rem 25,
 1020:              $a + I div (25*25*25) rem 25,
 1021:              $a + I div (25*25) rem 25,
 1022:              $a+I div 25 rem 25, $a+I rem 25],
 1023:             lists:duplicate(100,$a+I rem 25)}
 1024:            || I <- lists:seq(1,Vars)],
 1025:     try erlang:open_port({spawn,Cmd},[exit_status, {env, Env}]) of
 1026:         P ->
 1027:             receive
 1028:                 {P, {exit_status,N}} = M when N > 127->
 1029:                     %% If exit status is > 127 something went very wrong
 1030:                     ct:fail("Open port failed got ~p",[M]);
 1031:                 {P, {exit_status,N}} = M ->
 1032:                     %% We test that the exit status is an integer, this means
 1033:                     %% that the child program has started. If we get an atom
 1034:                     %% something went wrong in the driver which is not ok.
 1035:                     ct:log("Got ~p",[M]),
 1036:                     true = is_integer(N)
 1037:             end
 1038:     catch E:R ->
 1039:               %% Have to catch the error here, as printing the stackdump
 1040:               %% in the ct log is way to heavy for some test machines.
 1041:               ct:fail("Open port failed ~p:~p",[E,R])
 1042:     end.
 1043: 
 1044: %% Test to spawn program with command payload buffer
 1045: %% just around pipe capacity (9f779819f6bda734c5953468f7798)
 1046: pipe_limit_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1047:     WSL = os:getenv("WSLENV") =/= false,
 1048:     Cmd = case os:type() of
 1049:               {win32,_} when WSL -> "cmd.exe /q /c wsl true";
 1050:               {win32,_} -> "cmd /q /c true";
 1051:               _ -> "true"
 1052:           end,
 1053:     CmdSize = command_payload_size(Cmd),
 1054:     Limits = [4096, 16384, 65536], % Try a couple of common pipe buffer sizes
 1055: 
 1056:     lists:foreach(fun(Lim) ->
 1057: 			  lists:foreach(fun(L) -> pipe_limit_env_do(L, Cmd, CmdSize)
 1058: 					end, lists:seq(Lim-5, Lim+5))
 1059: 		  end, Limits),
 1060:     ok.
 1061: 
 1062: pipe_limit_env_do(Bytes, Cmd, CmdSize) ->
 1063:     case env_of_bytes(Bytes-CmdSize) of
 1064: 	[] -> skip;
 1065: 	Env ->
 1066: 	    try erlang:open_port({spawn,Cmd},[exit_status, {env, Env}]) of
 1067: 		P ->
 1068: 		    receive
 1069: 			{P, {exit_status,N}} ->
 1070: 			    %% Bug caused exit_status 150 (EINVAL+128)
 1071: 			    0 = N
 1072: 		    end
 1073: 	    catch E:R ->
 1074: 		    %% Have to catch the error here, as printing the stackdump
 1075: 		    %% in the ct log is way to heavy for some test machines.
 1076: 		    ct:fail("Open port failed ~p:~p",[E,R])
 1077: 	    end
 1078:     end.
 1079: 
 1080: %% environ format: KEY=VALUE\0
 1081: env_of_bytes(Bytes) when Bytes > 3 ->
 1082:     [{"X",lists:duplicate(Bytes-3, $x)}];
 1083: env_of_bytes(_) -> [].
 1084: 
 1085: %% White box assumption about payload written to pipe
 1086: %% for Cmd and current environment (see spawn_start in sys_driver.c)
 1087: command_payload_size(Cmd) ->
 1088:     EnvSize = lists:foldl(fun(E,Acc) -> length(E) + 1 + Acc end,
 1089: 			  0, os:getenv()),
 1090:     {ok, PWD} = file:get_cwd(),
 1091:     (4                      % buffsz
 1092:      + 4                    % flags
 1093:      + 5 + length(Cmd) + 1  % "exec $Cmd"
 1094:      + length(PWD) + 1      % $PWD
 1095:      + 1                    % nullbuff
 1096:      + 4                    % env_len
 1097:      + EnvSize).
 1098: 
 1099: %%  Test bad 'args' options.
 1100: bad_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1101:     try_bad_args({args, [self()]}),
 1102:     try_bad_args({args, ["head" | "tail"]}),
 1103:     try_bad_args({args, ["head", "body" | "tail"]}),
 1104:     try_bad_args({args, [<<"head">>, <<"body">> | <<"tail">>]}),
 1105:     try_bad_args({args, not_a_list}),
 1106:     try_bad_args({args, ["string",<<"binary">>, 1472, "string"]}),
 1107:     try_bad_args({args, ["string",<<"binary">>], "element #3"}),
 1108:     ok.
 1109: 
 1110: try_bad_args(Args) ->
 1111:     badarg = try open_port({spawn_executable,"ls"}, [Args])
 1112: 	     catch
 1113: 		 error:badarg -> badarg
 1114: 	     end.
 1115: 
 1116: 
 1117: 
 1118: %% 'cd' option
 1119: %% (Can perhaps be made smaller by calling the other utility functions
 1120: %% in this module.)
 1121: %%
 1122: %% Test that the 'cd' option works
 1123: cd(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
 1124:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 1}),
 1125: 
 1126:     Program = ct:get_progname(),
 1127:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1128:     TestDir = filename:join(DataDir, "dir"),
 1129:     Cmd = Program ++ " -pz " ++ DataDir ++
 1130:     " -noshell -s port_test pwd -s erlang halt",
 1131:     _ = open_port({spawn, Cmd},
 1132:                   [{cd, TestDir}, {line, 256}]),
 1133:     receive
 1134:         {_, {data, {eol, String}}} ->
 1135:             case filename_equal(String, TestDir) of
 1136:                 true ->
 1137:                     ok;
 1138:                 false ->
 1139:                     ct:fail({cd, String})
 1140:             end;
 1141:         Other2 ->
 1142:             ct:fail({env, Other2})
 1143:     end,
 1144:     _ = open_port({spawn, Cmd},
 1145:                   [{cd, unicode:characters_to_binary(TestDir)},
 1146:                    {line, 256}]),
 1147:     receive
 1148:         {_, {data, {eol, String2}}} ->
 1149:             case filename_equal(String2, TestDir) of
 1150:                 true ->
 1151:                     ok;
 1152:                 false ->
 1153:                     ct:fail({cd, String2})
 1154:             end;
 1155:         Other3 ->
 1156:             ct:fail({env, Other3})
 1157:     end,
 1158: 
 1159:     InvalidDir = filename:join(DataDir, "invaliddir"),
 1160:     try open_port({spawn, Cmd},
 1161:                   [{cd, InvalidDir}, exit_status, {line, 256}]) of
 1162:         _ ->
 1163:             receive
 1164:                 {_, {exit_status, _}} ->
 1165:                     ok;
 1166:                 Other4 ->
 1167:                     ct:fail({env, Other4})
 1168:             end
 1169:     catch error:eacces ->
 1170:             %% This happens on Windows
 1171:             ok
 1172:     end,
 1173: 
 1174:     %% Check that there are no lingering messages
 1175:     receive
 1176:         Other5 ->
 1177:             ct:fail({env, Other5})
 1178:     after 10 ->
 1179:             ok
 1180:     end.
 1181: 
 1182: %% Test that an emulator that has set it's cwd to
 1183: %% something other then when it started, can use
 1184: %% relative {cd,"./"} to open port and that cd will
 1185: %% be relative the new cwd and not the original
 1186: cd_relative(Config) ->
 1187: 
 1188:     Program = ct:get_progname(),
 1189:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1190:     TestDir = filename:join(DataDir, "dir"),
 1191: 
 1192:     Cmd = Program ++ " -pz " ++ filename:dirname(code:where_is_file("port_SUITE.beam")) ++
 1193:     " -noshell -s port_SUITE relative_cd -s erlang halt",
 1194: 
 1195:     _ = open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [{line, 256}, {cd, TestDir}]),
 1196: 
 1197:     receive
 1198:         {_, {data, {eol, String}}} ->
 1199:             case filename_equal(String, TestDir) of
 1200:                 true ->
 1201:                     ok;
 1202:                 false ->
 1203:                     ct:fail({cd_relative, String})
 1204:             end;
 1205:         Other ->
 1206:             ct:fail(Other)
 1207:     end.
 1208: 
 1209: relative_cd() ->
 1210: 
 1211:     Program = ct:get_progname(),
 1212:     ok = file:set_cwd(".."),
 1213:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1214: 
 1215:     Cmd = Program ++ " -pz " ++ Cwd ++
 1216:     " -noshell -s port_test pwd -s erlang halt",
 1217: 
 1218:     _ = open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [{line, 256}, {cd, "./dir"}, exit_status]),
 1219: 
 1220:     receive
 1221:         {_, {data, {eol, String}}} ->
 1222:             io:format("~s~n",[String]);
 1223:         Other ->
 1224:             io:format("ERROR: ~p~n",[Other])
 1225:     end.
 1226: 
 1227: filename_equal(A, B) ->
 1228:     case os:type() of
 1229:         {win32, _} ->
 1230:             win_filename_equal(A, B);
 1231:         _ ->
 1232:             A == B
 1233:     end.
 1234: 
 1235: win_filename_equal([], []) ->
 1236:     true;
 1237: win_filename_equal([], _) ->
 1238:     false;
 1239: win_filename_equal(_, []) ->
 1240:     false;
 1241: win_filename_equal([C1 | Rest1], [C2 | Rest2]) ->
 1242:     case tolower(C1) == tolower(C2) of
 1243:         true ->
 1244:             win_filename_equal(Rest1, Rest2);
 1245:         false ->
 1246:             false
 1247:     end.
 1248: 
 1249: tolower(C) when C >= $A, C =< $Z ->
 1250:     C + 32;
 1251: tolower(C) ->
 1252:     C.
 1253: 
 1254: %% Tests that child process deaths are managed correctly when there are
 1255: %%  a large amount of concurrently dying children. See ticket OTP-3906.
 1256: otp_3906(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
 1257:     case os:type() of
 1258:         {unix, OSName} ->
 1259:             otp_3906(Config, OSName);
 1260:         _ ->
 1261:             {skipped, "Only run on Unix systems"}
 1262:     end.
 1263: 
 1264: -define(OTP_3906_CHILDREN,     1000).
 1265: -define(OTP_3906_EXIT_STATUS,  17).
 1266: -define(OTP_3906_PROGNAME,     "otp_3906").
 1267: -define(OTP_3906_TICK_TIMEOUT, 5000).
 1268: -define(OTP_3906_OSP_P_ERLP,   10).
 1269: -define(OTP_3906_MAX_CONC_OSP, 50).
 1270: 
 1271: otp_3906(Config, OSName) ->
 1272:     DataDir = filename:dirname(proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config)),
 1273:     {ok, Variables, _} = file:path_consult(code:get_path(),"variables"),
 1274:     case lists:keysearch('CC', 1, Variables) of
 1275:         {value,{'CC', CC}} ->
 1276:             PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1277:             Prog = otp_3906_make_prog(CC, PrivDir),
 1278:             {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1279:             OP = process_flag(priority, max),
 1280:             OTE = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1281:             FS = spawn_link(Node,
 1282:                             ?MODULE,
 1283:                             otp_3906_start_forker_starter,
 1284:                             [?OTP_3906_CHILDREN, [], self(), Prog]),
 1285:             Result = receive
 1286:                          {'EXIT', _ForkerStarter, Reason} ->
 1287:                              {failed, Reason};
 1288:                          {emulator_pid, EmPid} ->
 1289:                              case otp_3906_wait_result(FS, 0, 0) of
 1290:                                  {succeeded,
 1291:                                   ?OTP_3906_CHILDREN,
 1292:                                   ?OTP_3906_CHILDREN} ->
 1293:                                      succeeded;
 1294:                                  {succeeded, Forked, Exited} ->
 1295:                                      otp_3906_list_defunct(EmPid, OSName),
 1296:                                      {failed,
 1297:                                       {mismatch,
 1298:                                        {forked, Forked},
 1299:                                        {exited, Exited}}};
 1300:                                  Res ->
 1301:                                      otp_3906_list_defunct(EmPid, OSName),
 1302:                                      Res
 1303:                              end
 1304:                      end,
 1305:             process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
 1306:             process_flag(priority, OP),
 1307:             peer:stop(Peer),
 1308:             case Result of
 1309:                 succeeded ->
 1310:                     ok;
 1311:                 _ ->
 1312:                     ct:fail(Result)
 1313:             end;
 1314:         _ ->
 1315:             {skipped, "No C compiler found"}
 1316:     end.
 1317: 
 1318: otp_3906_list_defunct(EmPid, OSName) ->
 1319:     % Guess ps switches to use and what to grep for (could be improved)
 1320:     {Switches, Zombie} = case OSName of
 1321:                              BSD when BSD == darwin;
 1322:                                       BSD == openbsd;
 1323:                                       BSD == netbsd;
 1324:                                       BSD == freebsd ->
 1325:                                  {"-ajx", "Z"};
 1326:                              _ ->
 1327:                                  {"-ef", "[dD]efunct"}
 1328:                          end,
 1329:     io:format("Emulator pid: ~s~n"
 1330:               "Listing of zombie processes:~n"
 1331:               "~s~n",
 1332:               [EmPid,
 1333:                otp_3906_htmlize(os:cmd("ps "
 1334:                                        ++ Switches
 1335:                                        ++ " | grep "
 1336:                                        ++ Zombie))]).
 1337: 
 1338: otp_3906_htmlize([]) ->
 1339:     [];
 1340: otp_3906_htmlize([C | Cs]) ->
 1341:     case [C] of
 1342:         "<" -> "&lt;" ++ otp_3906_htmlize(Cs);
 1343:         ">" -> "&gt;" ++ otp_3906_htmlize(Cs);
 1344:         _ ->   [C | otp_3906_htmlize(Cs)]
 1345:     end.
 1346: 
 1347: otp_3906_make_prog(CC, PrivDir) ->
 1348:     SrcFileName = filename:join(PrivDir, ?OTP_3906_PROGNAME ++ ".c"),
 1349:     TrgtFileName = filename:join(PrivDir, ?OTP_3906_PROGNAME),
 1350:     {ok, SrcFile} = file:open(SrcFileName, write),
 1351:     io:format(SrcFile,
 1352:               "int           ~n"
 1353:               "main(void)    ~n"
 1354:               "{             ~n"
 1355:               "   return ~p; ~n"
 1356:               "}             ~n",
 1357:               [?OTP_3906_EXIT_STATUS]),
 1358:     file:close(SrcFile),
 1359:     os:cmd(CC ++ " " ++ SrcFileName ++ " -o " ++ TrgtFileName),
 1360:     TrgtFileName.
 1361: 
 1362: 
 1363: otp_3906_wait_result(ForkerStarter, F, E) ->
 1364:     receive
 1365:         {'EXIT', ForkerStarter, Reason} ->
 1366:             {failed, {Reason, {forked, F}, {exited, E}}};
 1367:         forked ->
 1368:             otp_3906_wait_result(ForkerStarter, F+1, E);
 1369:         exited ->
 1370:             otp_3906_wait_result(ForkerStarter, F, E+1);
 1371:         tick ->
 1372:             otp_3906_wait_result(ForkerStarter, F, E);
 1373:         succeeded ->
 1374:             {succeeded, F, E}
 1375:     after
 1376:         ?OTP_3906_TICK_TIMEOUT ->
 1377:             unlink(ForkerStarter),
 1378:             exit(ForkerStarter, timeout),
 1379:             {failed, {timeout, {forked, F}, {exited, E}}}
 1380:     end.
 1381: 
 1382: otp_3906_collect([], _) ->
 1383:     done;
 1384: otp_3906_collect(RefList, Sup) ->
 1385:     otp_3906_collect(otp_3906_collect_one(RefList, Sup), Sup).
 1386: 
 1387: otp_3906_collect_one(RefList, Sup) ->
 1388:     receive
 1389:         Ref when is_reference(Ref) ->
 1390:             Sup ! tick,
 1391:             lists:delete(Ref, RefList)
 1392:     end.
 1393: 
 1394: otp_3906_start_forker(N, Sup, Prog) ->
 1395:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1396:     spawn_opt(?MODULE,
 1397:               otp_3906_forker,
 1398:               [N, self(), Ref, Sup, Prog],
 1399:               [link, {priority, max}]),
 1400:     Ref.
 1401: 
 1402: otp_3906_start_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog) ->
 1403:     process_flag(priority, max),
 1404:     EmPid = os:getpid(),
 1405:     Sup ! {emulator_pid, EmPid},
 1406:     otp_3906_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog).
 1407: 
 1408: otp_3906_forker_starter(0, RefList, Sup, _) ->
 1409:     otp_3906_collect(RefList, Sup),
 1410:     unlink(Sup),
 1411:     Sup ! succeeded;
 1412: otp_3906_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog)
 1413:   when length(RefList) >= ?OTP_3906_MAX_CONC_OSP ->
 1414:     otp_3906_forker_starter(N, otp_3906_collect_one(RefList, Sup), Sup, Prog);
 1415: otp_3906_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog)
 1416:   when is_integer(N), N > ?OTP_3906_OSP_P_ERLP ->
 1417:     otp_3906_forker_starter(N-?OTP_3906_OSP_P_ERLP,
 1418:                             [otp_3906_start_forker(?OTP_3906_OSP_P_ERLP,
 1419:                                                    Sup,
 1420:                                                    Prog)|RefList],
 1421:                             Sup,
 1422:                             Prog);
 1423: otp_3906_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog) when is_integer(N) ->
 1424:     otp_3906_forker_starter(0,
 1425:                             [otp_3906_start_forker(N,
 1426:                                                    Sup,
 1427:                                                    Prog)|RefList],
 1428:                             Sup,
 1429:                             Prog).
 1430: 
 1431: otp_3906_forker(0, Parent, Ref, _, _) ->
 1432:     unlink(Parent),
 1433:     Parent ! Ref;
 1434: otp_3906_forker(N, Parent, Ref, Sup, Prog) ->
 1435:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn, Prog}, [exit_status, in]),
 1436:     Sup ! forked,
 1437:     receive
 1438:         {Port, {exit_status, ?OTP_3906_EXIT_STATUS}} ->
 1439:             Sup ! exited,
 1440:             otp_3906_forker(N-1, Parent, Ref, Sup, Prog);
 1441:         {Port, Res} ->
 1442:             exit(Res);
 1443:         Other ->
 1444:             exit(Other)
 1445:     end.
 1446: 
 1447: 
 1448: otp_4389(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
 1449:     case os:type() of
 1450:         {unix, _} ->
 1451:             ct:timetrap({minutes, 4}),
 1452:             TCR = self(),
 1453:             %% On MacOS Catalina libc can return enoent instead of emfile for cwd
 1454:             BrokenCWD = (os:type() =:= {unix,darwin}) andalso element(1,os:version()) == 19,
 1455:             case get_true_cmd() of
 1456:                 True when is_list(True) ->
 1457:                     lists:foreach(
 1458:                       fun (P) ->
 1459:                               receive
 1460:                                   {P, ok} ->  ok;
 1461:                                   {P, Err} -> ct:fail(Err)
 1462:                               end
 1463:                       end,
 1464:                       lists:map(
 1465:                         fun(_) ->
 1466:                                 spawn_link(
 1467:                                   fun() ->
 1468:                                           process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1469:                                           case catch open_port({spawn, True},
 1470:                                                                [stream,exit_status]) of
 1471:                                               P when is_port(P) ->
 1472:                                                   receive
 1473:                                                       {P,{exit_status,_}} ->
 1474:                                                           TCR ! {self(),ok};
 1475:                                                       {'EXIT',_,{R2,_}}
 1476:                                                         when R2 == emfile;
 1477:                                                              R2 == eagain;
 1478:                                                              R2 == enomem;
 1479:                                                              R2 == enoent andalso BrokenCWD ->
 1480:                                                           TCR ! {self(),ok};
 1481:                                                       Err2 ->
 1482:                                                           TCR ! {self(),{msg,Err2}}
 1483:                                                   end;
 1484:                                               {'EXIT',{R1,_}}
 1485:                                                 when R1 == emfile;
 1486:                                                      R1 == eagain;
 1487:                                                      R1 == enomem;
 1488:                                                      R1 == enoent andalso BrokenCWD ->
 1489:                                                   TCR ! {self(),ok};
 1490:                                               Err1 ->
 1491:                                                   TCR ! {self(), {open_port,Err1}}
 1492:                                           end
 1493:                                   end)
 1494:                         end,
 1495:                         lists:duplicate(1000,[]))),
 1496:                     {comment,
 1497:                      "This test case doesn't always fail when the bug that "
 1498:                      "it tests for is present (it is most likely to fail on"
 1499:                      " a multi processor machine). If the test case fails it"
 1500:                      " will fail by deadlocking the emulator."};
 1501:                 _ ->
 1502:                     {skipped, "\"true\" command not found"}
 1503:             end;
 1504:         _ ->
 1505:             {skip,"Only run on Unix"}
 1506:     end.
 1507: 
 1508: get_true_cmd() ->
 1509:     DoFileExist = fun (FileName) ->
 1510:                           case file:read_file_info(FileName) of
 1511:                               {ok, _} -> throw(FileName);
 1512:                               _ -> not_found
 1513:                           end
 1514:                   end,
 1515:     catch begin
 1516:               %% First check in /usr/bin and /bin
 1517:               DoFileExist("/usr/bin/true"),
 1518:               DoFileExist("/bin/true"),
 1519:               %% Try which
 1520:               case filename:dirname(os:cmd("which true")) of
 1521:                   "." -> not_found;
 1522:                   TrueDir -> filename:join(TrueDir, "true")
 1523:               end
 1524:           end.
 1525: 
 1526: %% 'exit_status' option
 1527: %%
 1528: %% Test that the 'exit_status' option works
 1529: exit_status(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
 1530:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 1}),
 1531:     port_expect(Config,
 1532:                 [{"x", [{exit_status, 5}]}],
 1533:                 1, "", [exit_status]),
 1534:     ok.
 1535: 
 1536: %% Test spawning a driver specifically
 1537: spawn_driver(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1538:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1539:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
 1540:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"}, []),
 1541:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Hello port!"}},
 1542:     receive
 1543:         {Port, {data, "Hello port!"}} = Msg1 ->
 1544:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg1]),
 1545:             ok;
 1546:         Other ->
 1547:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
 1548:     end,
 1549:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1550:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1551: 
 1552:     Port2 = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv -Hello port?"},
 1553:                              []),
 1554:     receive
 1555:         {Port2, {data, "Hello port?"}} = Msg2 ->
 1556:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg2]),
 1557:             ok;
 1558:         Other2 ->
 1559:             ct:fail({unexpected2, Other2})
 1560:     end,
 1561:     Port2 ! {self(), close},
 1562:     receive {Port2, closed} -> ok end,
 1563:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "ls"}, [])),
 1564:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "cmd"}, [])),
 1565:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, os:find_executable("erl")}, [])),
 1566:     ok.
 1567: 
 1568: %% Test parallelism option of open_port
 1569: parallelism_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1570:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1571:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
 1572:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"},
 1573:                             [{parallelism, true}]),
 1574:     {parallelism, true} = erlang:port_info(Port, parallelism),
 1575:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Hello port!"}},
 1576:     receive
 1577:         {Port, {data, "Hello port!"}} = Msg1 ->
 1578:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg1]),
 1579:             ok;
 1580:         Other ->
 1581:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
 1582:     end,
 1583:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1584:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1585: 
 1586:     Port2 = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv -Hello port?"},
 1587:                              [{parallelism, false}]),
 1588:     {parallelism, false} = erlang:port_info(Port2, parallelism),
 1589:     receive
 1590:         {Port2, {data, "Hello port?"}} = Msg2 ->
 1591:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg2]),
 1592:             ok;
 1593:         Other2 ->
 1594:             ct:fail({unexpected2, Other2})
 1595:     end,
 1596:     Port2 ! {self(), close},
 1597:     receive {Port2, closed} -> ok end,
 1598:     ok.
 1599: 
 1600: %% Test spawning an executable specifically
 1601: spawn_executable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1602:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1603:     EchoArgs1 = filename:join([DataDir,"echo_args"]),
 1604:     ExactFile1 = filename:nativename(os:find_executable(EchoArgs1)),
 1605:     [ExactFile1] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[]),
 1606:     [ExactFile1] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary]),
 1607:     ["echo_args"] = run_echo_args(DataDir,["echo_args"]),
 1608:     ["echo_args"] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary, "echo_args"]),
 1609:     ["echo_arguments"] = run_echo_args(DataDir,["echo_arguments"]),
 1610:     ["echo_arguments"] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary, "echo_arguments"]),
 1611:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1612:     run_echo_args(DataDir,[ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1613:     [ExactFile1] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[default]),
 1614:     [ExactFile1] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary, default]),
 1615:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1616:     run_echo_args(DataDir,[switch_order,ExactFile1,"hello world",
 1617:                            "dlrow olleh"]),
 1618:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1619:     run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary,switch_order,ExactFile1,"hello world",
 1620:                            "dlrow olleh"]),
 1621:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1622:     run_echo_args(DataDir,[default,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1623: 
 1624:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1625:     run_echo_args_2("\""++ExactFile1++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\""),
 1626:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1627:     run_echo_args_2(unicode:characters_to_binary("\""++ExactFile1++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\"")),
 1628: 
 1629:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1630:     SpaceDir = filename:join([PrivDir,"With Spaces"]),
 1631:     file:make_dir(SpaceDir),
 1632:     Executable = filename:basename(ExactFile1),
 1633:     file:copy(ExactFile1,filename:join([SpaceDir,Executable])),
 1634:     ExactFile2 = filename:nativename(filename:join([SpaceDir,Executable])),
 1635:     chmodplusx(ExactFile2),
 1636:     io:format("|~s|~n",[ExactFile2]),
 1637:     [ExactFile2] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[]),
 1638:     ["echo_args"] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,["echo_args"]),
 1639:     ["echo_arguments"] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,["echo_arguments"]),
 1640:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1641:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1642:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1643:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[binary, ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1644: 
 1645:     [ExactFile2,"hello \"world\"","\"dlrow\" olleh"] =
 1646:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[binary, ExactFile2,"hello \"world\"","\"dlrow\" olleh"]),
 1647:     [ExactFile2,"hello \"world\"","\"dlrow\" olleh"] =
 1648:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[binary, ExactFile2,"hello \"world\"","\"dlrow\" olleh"]),
 1649: 
 1650:     [ExactFile2] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[default]),
 1651:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1652:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[switch_order,ExactFile2,"hello world", "dlrow olleh"]),
 1653:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1654:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[default,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1655:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1656:     run_echo_args_2("\""++ExactFile2++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\""),
 1657:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1658:     run_echo_args_2(unicode:characters_to_binary("\""++ExactFile2++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\"")),
 1659: 
 1660:     ExeExt = filename:extension(ExactFile2),
 1661:     Executable2 = "spoky name"++ExeExt,
 1662:     file:copy(ExactFile1,filename:join([SpaceDir,Executable2])),
 1663:     ExactFile3 = filename:nativename(filename:join([SpaceDir,Executable2])),
 1664:     chmodplusx(ExactFile3),
 1665:     [ExactFile3] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,[]),
 1666:     ["echo_args"] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,["echo_args"]),
 1667:     ["echo_arguments"] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,["echo_arguments"]),
 1668:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1669:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,[ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1670:     [ExactFile3] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,[default]),
 1671:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1672:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,
 1673:                   [switch_order,ExactFile3,"hello world",
 1674:                    "dlrow olleh"]),
 1675:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1676:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,
 1677:                   [default,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1678:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1679:     run_echo_args_2("\""++ExactFile3++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\""),
 1680:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1681:     run_echo_args_2(unicode:characters_to_binary("\""++ExactFile3++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\"")),
 1682:     {'EXIT',{enoent,_}} = (catch run_echo_args(SpaceDir,"fnurflmonfi",
 1683:                                                [default,"hello world",
 1684:                                                 "dlrow olleh"])),
 1685: 
 1686:     NonExec = "kronxfrt"++ExeExt,
 1687:     file:write_file(filename:join([SpaceDir,NonExec]),
 1688:                     <<"Not an executable">>),
 1689:     {'EXIT',{eacces,_}} = (catch run_echo_args(SpaceDir,NonExec,
 1690:                                                [default,"hello world",
 1691:                                                 "dlrow olleh"])),
 1692:     {'EXIT',{enoent,_}} = (catch open_port({spawn_executable,"cmd"},[])),
 1693:     {'EXIT',{enoent,_}} = (catch open_port({spawn_executable,"sh"},[])),
 1694:     case os:type() of
 1695:         {win32,_} ->
 1696:             test_bat_file(SpaceDir);
 1697:         {unix,_} ->
 1698:             test_sh_file(SpaceDir)
 1699:     end,
 1700:     ok.
 1701: 
 1702: unregister_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1703:     Cmd = case os:getenv("WSLENV") of
 1704:               false -> "sleep 5";
 1705:               _ -> "wsl.exe sleep 5"
 1706:           end,
 1707:     true = register(crash, open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [])),
 1708:     true = unregister(crash).
 1709: 
 1710: test_bat_file(Dir) ->
 1711:     FN = "tf.bat",
 1712:     Full = filename:join([Dir,FN]),
 1713:     D = [<<"@echo off\r\n">>,
 1714:          <<"echo argv[0]:^|%0^|\r\n">>,
 1715:          <<"if \"%1\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1716:          <<"echo argv[1]:^|%1^|\r\n">>,
 1717:          <<"if \"%2\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1718:          <<"echo argv[2]:^|%2^|\r\n">>,
 1719:          <<"if \"%3\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1720:          <<"echo argv[3]:^|%3^|\r\n">>,
 1721:          <<"if \"%4\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1722:          <<"echo argv[4]:^|%4^|\r\n">>,
 1723:          <<"if \"%5\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1724:          <<"echo argv[5]:^|%5^|\r\n">>,
 1725:          <<"\r\n">>,
 1726:          <<":done\r\n">>,
 1727:          <<"\r\n">>],
 1728:     file:write_file(Full,list_to_binary(D)),
 1729:     EF = filename:basename(FN),
 1730:     [DN,"hello","world"] =
 1731:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1732:                   [default,"hello","world"]),
 1733:     %% The arg0 argument should be ignored when running batch files
 1734:     [DN,"hello","world"] =
 1735:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1736:                   ["knaskurt","hello","world"]),
 1737:     EF = filename:basename(DN),
 1738:     ok.
 1739: 
 1740: test_sh_file(Dir) ->
 1741:     FN = "tf.sh",
 1742:     Full = filename:join([Dir,FN]),
 1743:     D = [<<"#! /bin/sh\n">>,
 1744:          <<"echo 'argv[0]:|'$0'|'\n">>,
 1745:          <<"i=1\n">>,
 1746:          <<"while [ '!' -z \"$1\" ]; do\n">>,
 1747:          <<"    echo 'argv['$i']:|'\"$1\"'|'\n">>,
 1748:          <<"    shift\n">>,
 1749:          <<"    i=`expr $i + 1`\n">>,
 1750:          <<"done\n">>],
 1751:     file:write_file(Full,list_to_binary(D)),
 1752:     chmodplusx(Full),
 1753:     [Full,"hello","world"] =
 1754:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1755:                   [default,"hello","world"]),
 1756:     [Full,"hello","world of spaces"] =
 1757:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1758:                   [default,"hello","world of spaces"]),
 1759:     file:write_file(filename:join([Dir,"testfile1"]),<<"testdata1">>),
 1760:     file:write_file(filename:join([Dir,"testfile2"]),<<"testdata2">>),
 1761:     Pattern = filename:join([Dir,"testfile*"]),
 1762:     L = filelib:wildcard(Pattern),
 1763:     2 = length(L),
 1764:     [Full,"hello",Pattern] =
 1765:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1766:                   [default,"hello",Pattern]),
 1767:     ok.
 1768: 
 1769: 
 1770: 
 1771: chmodplusx(Filename) ->
 1772:     case file:read_file_info(Filename) of
 1773:         {ok,FI} ->
 1774:             FI2 = FI#file_info{mode = ((FI#file_info.mode) bor 8#00100)},
 1775:             file:write_file_info(Filename,FI2);
 1776:         _ ->
 1777:             ok
 1778:     end.
 1779: 
 1780: run_echo_args_2(FullnameAndArgs) ->
 1781:     Port = open_port({spawn,FullnameAndArgs},[eof]),
 1782:     Data = collect_data(Port),
 1783:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1784:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1785:     parse_echo_args_output(Data).
 1786: 
 1787: 
 1788: run_echo_args(Where,Args) ->
 1789:     run_echo_args(Where,"echo_args",Args).
 1790: run_echo_args(Where,Prog,Args) ->
 1791:     {Binary, ArgvArg} = pack_argv(Args),
 1792:     Command0 = filename:join([Where,Prog]),
 1793:     Command = case Binary of
 1794:                   true -> unicode:characters_to_binary(Command0);
 1795:                   false -> Command0
 1796:               end,
 1797:     Port = open_port({spawn_executable,Command},ArgvArg++[eof]),
 1798:     Data = collect_data(Port),
 1799:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1800:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1801:     parse_echo_args_output(Data).
 1802: 
 1803: pack_argv([binary|Args]) ->
 1804:     {true, pack_argv(Args, true)};
 1805: pack_argv(Args) ->
 1806:     {false, pack_argv(Args, false)}.
 1807: 
 1808: pack_argv(Args, Binary) ->
 1809:     case Args of
 1810:         [] ->
 1811:             [];
 1812:         [default|T] ->
 1813:             [{args,[make_bin(Arg,Binary) || Arg <- T]}];
 1814:         [switch_order,H|T] ->
 1815:             [{args,[make_bin(Arg,Binary) || Arg <- T]},{arg0,make_bin(H,Binary)}];
 1816:         [H|T] ->
 1817:             [{arg0,make_bin(H,Binary)},{args,[make_bin(Arg,Binary) || Arg <- T]}]
 1818:     end.
 1819: 
 1820: make_bin(Str, false) -> Str;
 1821: make_bin(Str, true) ->  unicode:characters_to_binary(Str).
 1822: 
 1823: collect_data(Port) ->
 1824:     receive
 1825:         {Port, {data, Data}} ->
 1826:             Data ++ collect_data(Port);
 1827:         {Port, eof} ->
 1828:             []
 1829:     end.
 1830: 
 1831: parse_echo_args_output(Data) ->
 1832:     [lists:last(string:lexemes(S,"|")) || S <- string:lexemes(Data,["\r\n",$\n])].
 1833: 
 1834: %% Test that the emulator does not mix up ports when the port table wraps
 1835: mix_up_ports(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1836:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1837:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
 1838:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn, "echo_drv"}, []),
 1839:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Hello port!"}},
 1840:     receive
 1841:         {Port, {data, "Hello port!"}} = Msg1 ->
 1842:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg1]),
 1843:             ok;
 1844:         Other ->
 1845:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
 1846:     end,
 1847:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1848:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1849:     loop(start, done,
 1850:          fun(P) ->
 1851:                  Q =
 1852:                  (catch erlang:open_port({spawn, "echo_drv"}, [])),
 1853:                  %%		       io:format("~p ", [Q]),
 1854:                  if is_port(Q) ->
 1855:                         Q;
 1856:                     true ->
 1857:                         io:format("~p~n", [P]),
 1858:                         done
 1859:                  end
 1860:          end),
 1861:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Hello again port!"}},
 1862:     receive
 1863:         Msg2 ->
 1864:             ct:fail({unexpected, Msg2})
 1865:     after 1000 ->
 1866:               ok
 1867:     end,
 1868:     ok.
 1869: 
 1870: loop(Stop, Stop, Fun) when is_function(Fun) ->
 1871:     ok;
 1872: loop(Start, Stop, Fun) when is_function(Fun) ->
 1873:     loop(Fun(Start), Stop, Fun).
 1874: 
 1875: 
 1876: %% Test that link to connected process is taken away when port calls
 1877: %% driver_exit() also when the port index has wrapped
 1878: otp_5112(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1879:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1880:     ok = load_driver(Path, "exit_drv"),
 1881:     Port = otp_5112_get_wrapped_port(),
 1882:     io:format("Max ports: ~p~n",[max_ports()]),
 1883:     io:format("Port: ~p~n",[Port]),
 1884:     {links, Links1} = process_info(self(),links),
 1885:     io:format("Links1: ~p~n",[Links1]),
 1886:     true = lists:member(Port, Links1),
 1887:     Port ! {self(), {command, ""}},
 1888:     wait_until(fun () -> lists:member(Port, erlang:ports()) == false end),
 1889:     receive after 1000 -> ok end, %% Give signal some time to propagate...
 1890:     {links, Links2} = process_info(self(),links),
 1891:     io:format("Links2: ~p~n",[Links2]),
 1892:     false = lists:member(Port, Links2), %% This used to fail
 1893:     ok.
 1894: 
 1895: otp_5112_get_wrapped_port() ->
 1896:     P1 = erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []),
 1897:     case port_ix(P1) < max_ports() of
 1898:         true ->
 1899:             io:format("Need to wrap port index (~p)~n", [P1]),
 1900:             otp_5112_wrap_port_ix([P1]),
 1901:             P2 = erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []),
 1902:             false = port_ix(P2) < max_ports(),
 1903:             P2;
 1904:         false ->
 1905:             io:format("Port index already wrapped (~p)~n", [P1]),
 1906:             P1
 1907:     end.
 1908: 
 1909: otp_5112_wrap_port_ix(Ports) ->
 1910:     case (catch erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, [])) of
 1911:         Port when is_port(Port) ->
 1912:             otp_5112_wrap_port_ix([Port|Ports]);
 1913:         _ ->
 1914:             %% Port table now full; empty port table
 1915:             lists:foreach(fun (P) ->  P ! {self(), close} end,
 1916:                           Ports),
 1917:             ok
 1918:     end.
 1919: 
 1920: 
 1921: %% Test that port index is not unnecessarily wrapped
 1922: otp_5119(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1923:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1924:     ok = load_driver(Path, "exit_drv"),
 1925:     PI1 = port_ix(otp_5119_fill_empty_port_tab([])),
 1926:     Port2 = erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []),
 1927:     PI2 = port_ix(Port2),
 1928:     {PortIx1, PortIx2} = case PI2 > PI1 of
 1929:                              true ->
 1930:                                  {PI1, PI2};
 1931:                              false ->
 1932:                                  {port_ix(otp_5119_fill_empty_port_tab([Port2])),
 1933:                                   port_ix(erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []))}
 1934:                          end,
 1935:     MaxPorts = max_ports(),
 1936:     io:format("PortIx1 = ~p ~p~n", [PI1, PortIx1]),
 1937:     io:format("PortIx2 = ~p ~p~n", [PI2, PortIx2]),
 1938:     io:format("MaxPorts = ~p~n", [MaxPorts]),
 1939:     true = PortIx2 > PortIx1,
 1940:     true = PortIx2 =< PortIx1 + MaxPorts,
 1941:     ok.
 1942: 
 1943: otp_5119_fill_empty_port_tab(Ports) ->
 1944:     case (catch erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, [])) of
 1945:         Port when is_port(Port) ->
 1946:             otp_5119_fill_empty_port_tab([Port|Ports]);
 1947:         _ ->
 1948:             %% Port table now full; empty port table
 1949:             lists:foreach(fun (P) ->  P ! {self(), close} end,
 1950:                           Ports),
 1951:             [LastPort|_] = Ports,
 1952:             LastPort
 1953:     end.
 1954: 
 1955: max_ports() ->
 1956:     erlang:system_info(port_limit).
 1957: 
 1958: port_ix(Port) when is_port(Port) ->
 1959:     ["#Port",_,PortIxStr] = string:lexemes(erlang:port_to_list(Port),
 1960:                                           "<.>"),
 1961:     list_to_integer(PortIxStr).
 1962: 
 1963: 
 1964: %% Check that port command failure doesn't crash the emulator
 1965: otp_6224(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1966:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1967:     ok = load_driver(Path, "failure_drv"),
 1968:     Go = make_ref(),
 1969:     Failer = spawn(fun () ->
 1970:                            receive Go -> ok end,
 1971:                            Port = open_port({spawn, "failure_drv"},
 1972:                                             []),
 1973:                            Port ! {self(), {command, "Fail, please!"}},
 1974:                            otp_6224_loop()
 1975:                    end),
 1976:     Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Failer),
 1977:     Failer ! Go,
 1978:     receive
 1979:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, Failer, Reason} ->
 1980:             case Reason of
 1981:                 {driver_failed, _} -> ok;
 1982:                 driver_failed -> ok;
 1983:                 _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_exit_reason,
 1984:                               Reason})
 1985:             end
 1986:     end,
 1987:     ok.
 1988: 
 1989: otp_6224_loop() ->
 1990:     receive _ -> ok after 0 -> ok end,
 1991:     otp_6224_loop().
 1992: 
 1993: 
 1994: -define(EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PROCS, 64).
 1995: -define(EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PORTS, 300).
 1996: 
 1997: exit_status_multi_scheduling_block(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1998:     Repeat = 3,
 1999:     case os:type() of
 2000:         {unix, _} ->
 2001:             ct:timetrap({minutes, 2*Repeat}),
 2002:             SleepSecs = 6,
 2003:             try
 2004:                 lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
