 2005:                                       exit_status_msb_test(Config,
 2006:                                                            SleepSecs)
 2007:                               end,
 2008:                               lists:seq(1, Repeat))
 2009:             after
 2010:                 %% Wait for the system to recover (regardless
 2011:                 %% of success or not) otherwise later testcases
 2012:                 %% may unnecessarily fail.
 2013:                 receive after SleepSecs+500 -> ok end
 2014:             end;
 2015:         _ -> {skip, "Not implemented for this OS"}
 2016:     end.
 2017: 
 2018: exit_status_msb_test(Config, SleepSecs) when is_list(Config) ->
 2019:     %%
 2020:     %% We want to start port programs from as many schedulers as possible
 2021:     %% and we want these port programs to terminate while multi-scheduling
 2022:     %% is blocked.
 2023:     %%
 2024:     NoSchedsOnln = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2025:     Parent = self(),
 2026:     io:format("SleepSecs = ~p~n", [SleepSecs]),
 2027:     PortProg = "sleep " ++ integer_to_list(SleepSecs),
 2028:     Start = erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond),
 2029:     NoProcs = case NoSchedsOnln of
 2030:                   NProcs when NProcs < ?EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PROCS ->
 2031:                       NProcs;
 2032:                   _ ->
 2033:                       ?EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PROCS
 2034:               end,
 2035:     NoPortsPerProc = case 20*NoProcs of
 2036:                          TNPorts when TNPorts < ?EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PORTS -> 20;
 2037:                          _ -> ?EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PORTS div NoProcs
 2038:                      end,
 2039:     io:format("NoProcs = ~p~nNoPortsPerProc = ~p~n",
 2040:               [NoProcs, NoPortsPerProc]),
 2041:     ProcFun
 2042:     = fun () ->
 2043:               PrtSIds = lists:map(
 2044:                           fun (_) ->
 2045:                                   erlang:yield(),
 2046:                                   case catch open_port({spawn, PortProg},
 2047:                                                        [exit_status]) of
 2048:                                       Prt when is_port(Prt) ->
 2049:                                           {Prt,
 2050:                                            erlang:system_info(scheduler_id)};
 2051:                                       {'EXIT', {Err, _}} when Err == eagain;
 2052:                                                               Err == emfile;
 2053:                                                               Err == enomem ->
 2054:                                           noop;
 2055:                                       {'EXIT', Err} when Err == eagain;
 2056:                                                          Err == emfile;
 2057:                                                          Err == enomem ->
 2058:                                           noop;
 2059:                                       Error ->
 2060:                                           ct:fail(Error)
 2061:                                   end
 2062:                           end,
 2063:                           lists:seq(1, NoPortsPerProc)),
 2064:               SIds = lists:filter(fun (noop) -> false;
 2065:                                       (_) -> true
 2066:                                   end,
 2067:                                   lists:map(fun (noop) -> noop;
 2068:                                                 ({_, SId}) -> SId
 2069:                                             end,
 2070:                                             PrtSIds)),
 2071:               process_flag(scheduler, 0),
 2072:               Parent ! {self(), started, SIds},
 2073:               lists:foreach(
 2074:                 fun (noop) ->
 2075:                         noop;
 2076:                     ({Port, _}) ->
 2077:                         receive
 2078:                             {Port, {exit_status, 0}} ->
 2079:                                 ok;
 2080:                             {Port, {exit_status, Status}} when Status > 128 ->
 2081:                                 %% Sometimes happens when we have created
 2082:                                 %% too many ports.
 2083:                                 ok;
 2084:                             {Port, {exit_status, _}} = ESMsg ->
 2085:                                 {Port, {exit_status, 0}} = ESMsg
 2086:                         end
 2087:                 end,
 2088:                 PrtSIds),
 2089:               Parent ! {self(), done}
 2090:       end,
 2091:     Procs = lists:map(fun (N) ->
 2092:                               spawn_opt(ProcFun,
 2093:                                         [link,
 2094:                                          {scheduler,
 2095:                                           (N rem NoSchedsOnln)+1}])
 2096:                       end,
 2097:                       lists:seq(1, NoProcs)),
 2098:     SIds = lists:map(fun (P) ->
 2099:                              receive {P, started, SIds} -> SIds end
 2100:                      end,
 2101:                      Procs),
 2102:     StartedTime = (erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond) - Start)/1000000,
 2103:     io:format("StartedTime = ~p~n", [StartedTime]),
 2104:     true = StartedTime < SleepSecs,
 2105:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2106:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> receive {P, done} -> ok end end, Procs),
 2107:     DoneTime = (erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond) - Start)/1000000,
 2108:     io:format("DoneTime = ~p~n", [DoneTime]),
 2109:     true = DoneTime > SleepSecs,
 2110:     ok = verify_multi_scheduling_blocked(),
 2111:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2112:     case {length(lists:usort(lists:flatten(SIds))), NoSchedsOnln} of
 2113:         {N, N} ->
 2114:             ok;
 2115:         {N, M} ->
 2116:             ct:fail("Failed to create ports on all ~w available"
 2117:                     "schedulers. Only created ports on ~w schedulers.", [M, N])
 2118:     end.
 2119: 
 2120: save_sid(SIds) ->
 2121:     SId = erlang:system_info(scheduler_id),
 2122:     case lists:member(SId, SIds) of
 2123:         true -> SIds;
 2124:         false -> [SId|SIds]
 2125:     end.
 2126: 
 2127: sid_proc(SIds) ->
 2128:     NewSIds = save_sid(SIds),
 2129:     receive
 2130:         {From, want_sids} ->
 2131:             From ! {self(), sids, NewSIds}
 2132:     after 0 ->
 2133:               sid_proc(NewSIds)
 2134:     end.
 2135: 
 2136: verify_multi_scheduling_blocked() ->
 2137:     Procs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2138:                               spawn_link(fun () -> sid_proc([]) end)
 2139:                       end,
 2140:                       lists:seq(1, 3*erlang:system_info(schedulers_online))),
 2141:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2142:     SIds = lists:map(fun (P) ->
 2143:                              P ! {self(), want_sids},
 2144:                              receive {P, sids, PSIds} -> PSIds end
 2145:                      end,
 2146:                      Procs),
 2147:     1 = length(lists:usort(lists:flatten(SIds))),
 2148:     ok.
 2149: 
 2150: 
 2151: %%% Pinging functions.
 2152: 
 2153: stream_ping(Config, Size, CmdLine, Options) ->
 2154:     Data = random_packet(Size),
 2155:     port_expect(Config, [{Data, [Data]}], 0, CmdLine, Options).
 2156: 
 2157: ping(Config, Sizes, HSize, CmdLine, Options) ->
 2158:     Actions = lists:map(fun(Size) ->
 2159:                                 [$p|Packet] = random_packet(Size, "ping"),
 2160:                                 {[$p|Packet], [[$P|Packet]]}
 2161:                         end,
 2162:                         Sizes),
 2163:     port_expect(Config, Actions, HSize, CmdLine, Options).
 2164: 
 2165: %% expect_input(Sizes, HSize, CmdLine, Options)
 2166: %%
 2167: %% Sizes = Size of packets to generated.
 2168: %% HSize = Header size: 1, 2, or 4
 2169: %% CmdLine = Additional command line options.
 2170: %% Options = Additional port options.
 2171: 
 2172: expect_input(Config, Sizes, HSize, CmdLine, Options) ->
 2173:     expect_input1(Config, Sizes, {HSize, CmdLine, Options}, [], []).
 2174: 
 2175: expect_input1(Config, [0|Rest], Params, Expect, ReplyCommand) ->
 2176:     expect_input1(Config, Rest, Params, [""|Expect], ["x0"|ReplyCommand]);
 2177: expect_input1(Config, [Size|Rest], Params, Expect, ReplyCommand) ->
 2178:     Packet = random_packet(Size),
 2179:     Fmt = io_lib:format("~c~p", [hd(Packet), Size]),
 2180:     expect_input1(Config, Rest, Params, [Packet|Expect], [Fmt|ReplyCommand]);
 2181: expect_input1(Config, [], {HSize, CmdLine0, Options}, Expect, ReplyCommand) ->
 2182:     CmdLine = build_cmd_line(CmdLine0, ReplyCommand, []),
 2183:     port_expect(Config, [{false, lists:reverse(Expect)}],
 2184:                 HSize, CmdLine, Options).
 2185: 
 2186: build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, [Cmd|Rest], []) ->
 2187:     build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, Rest, [Cmd]);
 2188: build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, [Cmd|Rest], Result) ->
 2189:     build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, Rest, [Cmd, $:|Result]);
 2190: build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, [], Result) ->
 2191:     lists:flatten([FixedCmdLine, " -r", Result, " -n"]).
 2192: 
 2193: %% port_expect(Actions, HSize, CmdLine, Options)
 2194: %%
 2195: %% Actions = [{Send, ExpectList}|Rest]
 2196: %% HSize = 0 (stream), or 1, 2, 4   (header size aka "packet bytes")
 2197: %% CmdLine = Command line for port_test.  Don't include -h<digit>.
 2198: %% Options = Options for open_port/2.  Don't include {packet, Number} or
 2199: %%           or stream.
 2200: %%
 2201: %% Send = false | list()
 2202: %% ExpectList = List of lists or binaries.
 2203: %%
 2204: %% Returns the port.
 2205: 
 2206: port_expect(Config, Actions, HSize, CmdLine, Options0) ->
 2207:     %    io:format("port_expect(~p, ~p, ~p, ~p)",
 2208:     %		[Actions, HSize, CmdLine, Options0]),
 2209:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
 2210:     Cmd = lists:concat([PortTest, " -h", HSize, " ", CmdLine]),
 2211:     PortType =
 2212:     case HSize of
 2213:         0 -> stream;
 2214:         _ -> {packet, HSize}
 2215:     end,
 2216:     Options = [PortType|Options0],
 2217:     ct:log("open_port({spawn, ~p}, ~p)", [Cmd, Options]),
 2218:     Port = open_port({spawn, Cmd}, Options),
 2219:     port_expect(Port, Actions, Options),
 2220:     Port.
 2221: 
 2222: port_expect(Port, [{Send, Expects}|Rest], Options) when is_list(Expects) ->
 2223:     port_send(Port, Send),
 2224:     IsBinaryPort = lists:member(binary, Options),
 2225:     Receiver =
 2226:     case {lists:member(stream, Options), line_option(Options)} of
 2227:         {false, _} -> fun receive_all/2;
 2228:         {true,false}  -> fun stream_receive_all/2;
 2229:         {_, true} -> fun receive_all/2
 2230:     end,
 2231:     Receiver(Port, maybe_to_binary(Expects, IsBinaryPort)),
 2232:     port_expect(Port, Rest, Options);
 2233: port_expect(_, [], _) ->
 2234:     ok.
 2235: 
 2236: %%% Check for either line or {line,N} in option list
 2237: line_option([{line,_}|_]) ->
 2238:     true;
 2239: line_option([line|_]) ->
 2240:     true;
 2241: line_option([_|T]) ->
 2242:     line_option(T);
 2243: line_option([]) ->
 2244:     false.
 2245: 
 2246: any_list_to_binary({Atom, List}) ->
 2247:     {Atom, list_to_binary(List)};
 2248: any_list_to_binary(List) ->
 2249:     list_to_binary(List).
 2250: 
 2251: maybe_to_binary(Expects, true) ->
 2252:     lists:map(fun any_list_to_binary/1, Expects);
 2253: maybe_to_binary(Expects, false) ->
 2254:     Expects.
 2255: 
 2256: port_send(_Port, false) -> ok;
 2257: port_send(Port, Send) when is_list(Send) ->
 2258:     %    io:format("port_send(~p, ~p)", [Port, Send]),
 2259:     Port ! {self(), {command, Send}}.
 2260: 
 2261: receive_all(Port, [Expect|Rest]) ->
 2262:     %    io:format("receive_all(~p, [~p|Rest])", [Port, Expect]),
 2263:     receive
 2264:         {Port, {data, Expect}} ->
 2265:             io:format("Received ~s", [format(Expect)]),
 2266:             ok;
 2267:         {Port, {data, Other}} ->
 2268:             io:format("Received ~s; expected ~s",
 2269:                       [format(Other), format(Expect)]),
 2270:             ct:fail(bad_message);
 2271:         Other ->
 2272:             %% (We're not yet prepared for receiving both 'eol' and
 2273:             %% 'exit_status'; remember that they may appear in any order.)
 2274:             case {Expect, Rest, Other} of
 2275:                 {eof, [], {Port, eof}} ->
 2276:                     io:format("Received soft EOF.",[]),
 2277:                     ok;
 2278:                 {{exit_status, S}, [], {Port, {exit_status, S}}} ->
 2279:                     io:format("Received exit status ~p.",[S]),
 2280:                     ok;
 2281:                 _ ->
 2282:                     %%%	            io:format("Unexpected message: ~s", [format(Other)]),
 2283:                     io:format("Unexpected message: ~w", [Other]),
 2284:                     ct:fail(unexpected_message)
 2285:             end
 2286:     end,
 2287:     receive_all(Port, Rest);
 2288: receive_all(_Port, []) ->
 2289:     ok.
 2290: 
 2291: stream_receive_all(Port, [Expect]) ->
 2292:     stream_receive_all1(Port, Expect).
 2293: 
 2294: stream_receive_all1(_Port, Empty) when is_binary(Empty), size(Empty) == 0 ->
 2295:     ok;
 2296: stream_receive_all1(_Port, []) ->
 2297:     ok;
 2298: stream_receive_all1(Port, Expect) ->
 2299:     receive
 2300:         {Port, {data, Data}} ->
 2301:             Remaining = compare(Data, Expect),
 2302:             stream_receive_all1(Port, Remaining);
 2303:         Other ->
 2304:             ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
 2305:     end.
 2306: 
 2307: compare(B1, B2) when is_binary(B1), is_binary(B2), byte_size(B1) =< byte_size(B2) ->
 2308:     case split_binary(B2, size(B1)) of
 2309:         {B1,Remaining} ->
 2310:             Remaining;
 2311:         _Other ->
 2312:             ct:fail(nomatch)
 2313:     end;
 2314: compare(B1, B2) when is_binary(B1), is_binary(B2) ->
 2315:     ct:fail(too_much_data);
 2316: compare([X|Rest1], [X|Rest2]) ->
 2317:     compare(Rest1, Rest2);
 2318: compare([_|_], [_|_]) ->
 2319:     ct:fail(nomatch);
 2320: compare([], Remaining) ->
 2321:     Remaining;
 2322: compare(_Data, []) ->
 2323:     ct:fail(too_much_data).
 2324: 
 2325: maybe_to_list(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 2326:     binary_to_list(Bin);
 2327: maybe_to_list(List) ->
 2328:     List.
 2329: 
 2330: format({Eol,List}) ->
 2331:     io_lib:format("tuple<~w,~w>",[Eol, maybe_to_list(List)]);
 2332: format(List) when is_list(List) ->
 2333:     case list_at_least(50, List) of
 2334:         true ->
 2335:             io_lib:format("\"~-50s...\"", [List]);
 2336:         false ->
 2337:             io_lib:format("~p", [List])
 2338:     end;
 2339: format(Bin) when is_binary(Bin), size(Bin) >= 50 ->
 2340:     io_lib:format("binary<~-50s...>", [binary_to_list(Bin, 1, 50)]);
 2341: format(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 2342:     io_lib:format("binary<~s>", [binary_to_list(Bin)]).
 2343: 
 2344: 
 2345: list_at_least(Number, [_|Rest]) when Number > 0 ->
 2346:     list_at_least(Number-1, Rest);
 2347: list_at_least(Number, []) when Number > 0 ->
 2348:     false;
 2349: list_at_least(0, _List) -> true.
 2350: 
 2351: 
 2352: %%% Utility functions.
 2353: 
 2354: random_packet(Size) ->
 2355:     random_packet(Size, "").
 2356: 
 2357: random_packet(Size, Prefix) ->
 2358:     build_packet(Size-length(Prefix), lists:reverse(Prefix), random_char()).
 2359: 
 2360: build_packet(0, Result, _NextChar) ->
 2361:     lists:reverse(Result);
 2362: build_packet(Left, Result, NextChar0) ->
 2363:     NextChar =
 2364:     if
 2365:         NextChar0 >= 126 ->
 2366:             33;
 2367:         true ->
 2368:             NextChar0+1
 2369:     end,
 2370:     build_packet(Left-1, [NextChar0|Result], NextChar).
 2371: 
 2372: sizes() ->
 2373:     [10, 13, 64, 127, 128, 255, 256, 1023, 1024,
 2374:      32767, 32768, 65535, 65536].
 2375: 
 2376: sizes(Header_Size) ->
 2377:     sizes(Header_Size, sizes(), []).
 2378: 
 2379: sizes(1, [Packet_Size|Rest], Result) when Packet_Size < 256 ->
 2380:     sizes(1, Rest, [Packet_Size|Result]);
 2381: sizes(2, [Packet_Size|Rest], Result) when Packet_Size < 65536 ->
 2382:     sizes(2, Rest, [Packet_Size|Result]);
 2383: sizes(4, [Packet_Size|Rest], Result) ->
 2384:     sizes(4, Rest, [Packet_Size|Result]);
 2385: sizes(_, _, Result) ->
 2386:     Result.
 2387: 
 2388: random_char() ->
 2389:     random_char("abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVXYZ0123456789").
 2390: 
 2391: random_char(Chars) ->
 2392:     lists:nth(uniform(length(Chars)), Chars).
 2393: 
 2394: uniform(N) ->
 2395:     case rand:export_seed() of
 2396:         undefined ->
 2397:             rand:seed(exsplus),
 2398:             io:format("Random seed = ~p\n", [rand:export_seed()]);
 2399:         _ ->
 2400:             ok
 2401:     end,
 2402:     rand:uniform(N).
 2403: 
 2404: fun_spawn(Fun) ->
 2405:     fun_spawn(Fun, []).
 2406: 
 2407: fun_spawn(Fun, Args) ->
 2408:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, Args]).
 2409: 
 2410: port_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2411:     filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "port_test").
 2412: 
 2413: %% Test that erlang:ports/0 returns a consistent snapshot of ports
 2414: ports(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2415:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2416:     ok = load_driver(Path, "exit_drv"),
 2417: 
 2418:     receive after 1000 -> ok end, % Wait for other ports to stabilize
 2419: 
 2420:     OtherPorts = erlang:ports(),
 2421:     io:format("Other ports: ~p\n",[OtherPorts]),
 2422:     MaxPorts = 1024 - length(OtherPorts),
 2423: 
 2424:     TrafficPid = spawn_link(fun() -> ports_traffic(MaxPorts) end),
 2425: 
 2426:     ports_snapshots(100, TrafficPid, OtherPorts),
 2427:     TrafficPid ! {self(),die},
 2428:     receive {TrafficPid, dead} -> ok end,
 2429:     ok.
 2430: 
 2431: ports_snapshots(0, _, _) ->
 2432:     ok;
 2433: ports_snapshots(Iter, TrafficPid, OtherPorts) ->
 2434: 
 2435:     TrafficPid ! start,
 2436:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
 2437: 
 2438:     Snapshot = erlang:ports(),
 2439: 
 2440:     TrafficPid ! {self(), stop},
 2441:     receive {TrafficPid, EventList, TrafficPorts} -> ok end,
 2442: 
 2443:     %%io:format("Snapshot=~p\n", [Snapshot]),
 2444:     ports_verify(Snapshot, OtherPorts ++ TrafficPorts, EventList),
 2445: 
 2446:     ports_snapshots(Iter-1, TrafficPid, OtherPorts).
 2447: 
 2448: 
 2449: ports_traffic(MaxPorts) ->
 2450:     ports_traffic_stopped(MaxPorts, {[],0}).
 2451: 
 2452: ports_traffic_stopped(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}) ->
 2453:     receive
 2454:         start ->
 2455:             %%io:format("Traffic started in ~p\n",[self()]),
 2456:             ports_traffic_started(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}, []);
 2457:         {Pid,die} ->
 2458:             lists:foreach(fun(Port)-> erlang:port_close(Port) end,
 2459:                           PortList),
 2460:             Pid ! {self(),dead}
 2461:     end.
 2462: 
 2463: ports_traffic_started(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}, EventList) ->
 2464:     receive
 2465:         {Pid, stop} ->
 2466:             %%io:format("Traffic stopped in ~p\n",[self()]),
 2467:             Pid ! {self(), EventList, PortList},
 2468:             ports_traffic_stopped(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt})
 2469: 
 2470:     after 0 ->
 2471:               ports_traffic_do(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}, EventList)
 2472:     end.
 2473: 
 2474: ports_traffic_do(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}, EventList) ->
 2475:     N = uniform(MaxPorts),
 2476:     case N > PortCnt of
 2477:         true -> % Open port
 2478:             P = open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []),
 2479:             %%io:format("Created port ~p\n",[P]),
 2480:             ports_traffic_started(MaxPorts, {[P|PortList], PortCnt+1},
 2481:                                   [{open,P}|EventList]);
 2482: 
 2483:         false -> % Close port
 2484:             P = lists:nth(N, PortList),
 2485:             %%io:format("Close port ~p\n",[P]),
 2486:             true = erlang:port_close(P),
 2487:             ports_traffic_started(MaxPorts, {lists:delete(P,PortList), PortCnt-1},
 2488:                                   [{close,P}|EventList])
 2489:     end.
 2490: 
 2491: ports_verify(Ports, PortsAfter, EventList) ->
 2492:     %%io:format("Candidate=~p\nEvents=~p\n", [PortsAfter, EventList]),
 2493:     case lists:sort(Ports) =:= lists:sort(PortsAfter) of
 2494:         true ->
 2495:             io:format("Snapshot of ~p ports verified ok.\n",[length(Ports)]),
 2496:             ok;
 2497:         false ->
 2498:             %% Note that we track the event list "backwards", undoing open/close:
 2499:             case EventList of
 2500:                 [{open,P} | Tail] ->
 2501:                     ports_verify(Ports, lists:delete(P,PortsAfter), Tail);
 2502: 
 2503:                 [{close,P} | Tail] ->
 2504:                     ports_verify(Ports, [P | PortsAfter], Tail);
 2505: 
 2506:                 [] ->
 2507:                     ct:fail("Inconsistent snapshot from erlang:ports()")
 2508:             end
 2509:     end.
 2510: 
 2511: load_driver(Dir, Driver) ->
 2512:     case erl_ddll:load_driver(Dir, Driver) of
 2513:         ok -> ok;
 2514:         {error, Error} = Res ->
 2515:             io:format("~s\n", [erl_ddll:format_error(Error)]),
 2516:             Res
 2517:     end.
 2518: 
 2519: 
 2520: %% Send data to port program that does not read it, then close port.
 2521: %% Primary targeting Windows to test threaded_handle_closer in sys.c
 2522: close_deaf_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2523:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
 2524:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2525:     DeadPort = os:find_executable("dead_port", DataDir),
 2526:     Port = open_port({spawn, DeadPort++" 60"},[]),
 2527:     erlang:port_command(Port,"Hello, can you hear me!?!?"),
 2528:     port_close(Port),
 2529: 
 2530:     Res = close_deaf_port_1(0, DeadPort),
 2531:     io:format("Waiting for OS procs to terminate...\n"),
 2532:     receive after 5*1000 -> ok end,
 2533:     Res.
 2534: 
 2535: close_deaf_port_1(200, _) ->
 2536:     ok;
 2537: close_deaf_port_1(N, Cmd) ->
 2538:     Timeout = integer_to_list(rand:uniform(5*1000)),
 2539:     try open_port({spawn_executable,Cmd},[{args,[Timeout]}]) of
 2540:         Port ->
 2541:             erlang:port_command(Port,"Hello, can you hear me!?!?"),
 2542:             port_close(Port),
 2543:             close_deaf_port_1(N+1, Cmd)
 2544:     catch
 2545:         _:eagain ->
 2546:             {comment, "Could not spawn more than " ++ integer_to_list(N) ++ " OS processes."}
 2547:     end.
 2548: 
 2549: %% Test undocumented port_set_data/2 and port_get_data/1
 2550: %% Hammer from multiple processes a while
 2551: %% and then abrubtly close the port (OTP-12208).
 2552: port_setget_data(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2553:     ok = load_driver(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "echo_drv"),
 2554:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"}, []),
 2555: 
 2556:     NSched = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2557:     HeapData = {1,2,3,<<"A heap binary">>,fun()->"This is fun"end,
 2558:                 list_to_binary(lists:seq(1,100))},
 2559:     PRs = lists:map(fun(I) ->
 2560:                             spawn_opt(fun() -> port_setget_data_hammer(Port,HeapData,false,1) end,
 2561:                                       [monitor, {scheduler, I rem NSched}])
 2562:                     end,
 2563:                     lists:seq(1,10)),
 2564:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2565:     Papa = self(),
 2566:     lists:foreach(fun({Pid,_}) -> Pid ! {Papa,prepare_for_close} end, PRs),
 2567:     lists:foreach(fun({Pid,_}) ->
 2568:                           receive {Pid,prepare_for_close} -> ok end
 2569:                   end,
 2570:                   PRs),
 2571:     port_close(Port),
 2572:     lists:foreach(fun({Pid,Ref}) ->
 2573:                           receive {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, normal} -> ok end
 2574:                   end,
 2575:                   PRs),
 2576:     ok.
 2577: 
 2578: port_setget_data_hammer(Port, HeapData, IsSet0, N) ->
 2579:     Rand = rand:uniform(3),
 2580:     IsSet1 = try case Rand of
 2581:                      1 -> true = erlang:port_set_data(Port, atom), true;
 2582:                      2 -> true = erlang:port_set_data(Port, HeapData), true;
 2583:                      3 -> case erlang:port_get_data(Port) of
 2584:                               atom -> true;
 2585:                               HeapData -> true;
 2586:                               undefined -> false=IsSet0
 2587:                           end
 2588:                  end
 2589:              catch
 2590:                  error:badarg ->
 2591:                      true = get(prepare_for_close),
 2592:                      io:format("~p did ~p rounds before port closed\n", [self(), N]),
 2593:                      exit(normal)
 2594:              end,
 2595:     receive {Papa, prepare_for_close} ->
 2596:                 put(prepare_for_close, true),
 2597:                 Papa ! {self(),prepare_for_close}
 2598:     after 0 ->
 2599:               ok
 2600:     end,
 2601:     port_setget_data_hammer(Port, HeapData, IsSet1, N+1).
 2602: 
 2603: 
 2604: wait_until(Fun) ->
 2605:     case catch Fun() of
 2606:         true ->
 2607:             ok;
 2608:         _ ->
 2609:             receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2610:             wait_until(Fun)
 2611:     end.
 2612: 
 2613: %% Attempt to monitor pid as port, and port as pid
 2614: mon_port_invalid_type(_Config) ->
 2615:     Port = hd(erlang:ports()),
 2616:     ?assertError(badarg, erlang:monitor(port, self())),
 2617:     ?assertError(badarg, erlang:monitor(process, Port)),
 2618:     ok.
 2619: 
 2620: %% With local port
 2621: mon_port_local(Config) ->
 2622:     Port1 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2623:     Ref1 = erlang:monitor(port, Port1),
 2624:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2625:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Port1)),
 2626:     Port1 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % port test will close self immediately
 2627:     receive ExitP1 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', Ref1, port, Port1, _}, ExitP1)
 2628:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2629:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2630:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Port1)),
 2631: 
 2632:     %% Trying to re-monitor a port which exists but is not healthy will
 2633:     %% succeed but then will immediately send DOWN
 2634:     Ref2 = erlang:monitor(port, Port1),
 2635:     receive ExitP2 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', Ref2, port, Port1, _}, ExitP2)
 2636:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2637:     ok.
 2638: 
 2639: %% With remote port on remote node (should fail)
 2640: mon_port_remote_on_remote(_Config) ->
 2641:     Port3 = binary_to_term(<<131, 102,          % Ext term format: PORT_EXT
 2642:                              100, 0, 13, "fgsfds@fgsfds", % Node :: ATOM_EXT
 2643:                              1:32/big,          % Id
 2644:                              0>>),              % Creation
 2645:     ?assertError(badarg, erlang:monitor(port, Port3)),
 2646:     ok.
 2647: 
 2648: %% Remote port belongs to this node and does not exist
 2649: %% Port4 produces #Port<0.167772160> which should not exist in a test run
 2650: mon_port_bad_remote_on_local(_Config) ->
 2651:     Port4 = binary_to_term(<<131, 102,          % Ext term format: PORT_EXT
 2652:                              100, 0, 13, "nonode@nohost", % Node
 2653:                              167772160:32/big,  % Id
 2654:                              0>>),              % Creation
 2655:     ?assertError(badarg, erlang:monitor(port, Port4)),
 2656:     ok.
 2657: 
 2658: %% Monitor owner (origin) dies before port is closed
 2659: mon_port_origin_dies(Config) ->
 2660:     Port5 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2661:     Self5 = self(),
 2662:     Proc5 = spawn(fun() ->
 2663:                       Self5 ! test5_started,
 2664:                       erlang:monitor(port, Port5),
 2665:                       receive stop -> ok end
 2666:                   end),
 2667:     erlang:monitor(process, Proc5), % we want to sync with its death
 2668:     receive test5_started -> ok
 2669:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2670:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2671:                  port_is_monitored(Proc5, Port5)),
 2672:     Proc5 ! stop,
 2673:     % receive from monitor (removing race condition)
 2674:     receive ExitP5 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', _, process, Proc5, _}, ExitP5)
 2675:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2676:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2677:                  port_is_monitored(Proc5, Port5)),
 2678:     Port5 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % make port quit
 2679:     ok.
 2680: 
 2681: %% Port and Monitor owner dies before port is closed
 2682: %% This testcase checks for a regression memory leak in erts
 2683: %% when the controlling and monitoring process is the same process
 2684: %% and the process dies
 2685: mon_port_owner_dies(Config) ->
 2686:     Self = self(),
 2687:     Proc = spawn(fun() ->
 2688:                          Port = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]),
 2689:                          Self ! {test_started, Port},
 2690:                          erlang:monitor(port, Port),
 2691:                          receive stop -> ok end
 2692:                   end),
 2693:     erlang:monitor(process, Proc), % we want to sync with its death
 2694:     Port = receive {test_started,P} -> P
 2695:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2696:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2697:                  port_is_monitored(Proc, Port)),
 2698:     Proc ! stop,
 2699:     %% receive from monitor
 2700:     receive ExitP5 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', _, process, Proc, _}, ExitP5)
 2701:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2702:     ok.
 2703: 
 2704: %% Monitor a named port
 2705: mon_port_named(Config) ->
 2706:     Name6 = test_port6,
 2707:     Port6 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2708:     erlang:register(Name6, Port6),
 2709:     erlang:monitor(port, Name6),
 2710:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2711:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Name6)),
 2712:     Port6 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % port test will close self immediately
 2713:     receive ExitP6 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', _, port, {Name6, _}, _}, ExitP6)
 2714:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2715:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2716:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Name6)),
 2717:     ok.
 2718: 
 2719: %% Named does not exist: Should succeed but immediately send 'DOWN'
 2720: mon_port_bad_named(_Config) ->
 2721:     Name7 = test_port7,
 2722:     erlang:monitor(port, Name7),
 2723:     receive {'DOWN', _, port, {Name7, _}, noproc} -> ok
 2724:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2725:     ok.
 2726: 
 2727: %% Monitor a pid and demonitor by ref
 2728: mon_port_pid_demonitor(Config) ->
 2729:     Port8 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2730:     Ref8 = erlang:monitor(port, Port8),
 2731:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2732:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Port8)),
 2733:     erlang:demonitor(Ref8),
 2734:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2735:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Port8)),
 2736:     Port8 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % port test will close self immediately
 2737:     ok.
 2738: 
 2739: %% Monitor by name and demonitor by ref
 2740: mon_port_name_demonitor(Config) ->
 2741:     Name9 = test_port9,
 2742:     Port9 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2743:     erlang:register(Name9, Port9),
 2744:     Ref9 = erlang:monitor(port, Name9),
 2745:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2746:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Name9)),
 2747:     erlang:demonitor(Ref9),
 2748:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2749:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Name9)),
 2750:     Port9 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % port test will close self immediately
 2751:     ok.
 2752: 
 2753: %% 1. Spawn a port which will sleep 3 seconds
 2754: %% 2. Port driver and dies horribly (via C driver_failure call). This should
 2755: %%    mark port as exiting or something.
 2756: %% 3. While the command happens, a monitor is requested on the port
 2757: mon_port_driver_die(Config) ->
 2758:     erlang:process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 2759: 
 2760:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2761:     ok = load_driver(Path, "sleep_failure_drv"),
 2762:     Port = open_port({spawn, "sleep_failure_drv"}, []),
 2763: 
 2764:     Self = self(),
 2765:     erlang:spawn_opt(fun() ->
 2766:                              timer:sleep(250),
 2767:                              Ref = erlang:monitor(port, Port),
 2768:                              %% Now check that msg actually arrives
 2769:                              receive
 2770:                                  {'DOWN', Ref, _Port2, _, _} = M -> Self ! M
 2771:                              after 3000 -> Self ! no_down_message
 2772:                              end
 2773:                      end,[{scheduler, 2}]),
 2774:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Fail, please!"}},
 2775:     receive
 2776:         A when is_atom(A) -> ?assertEqual(A, 'A_should_be_printed');
 2777:         {'DOWN', _R, port, Port, noproc} -> ok;
 2778:         {'DOWN', _R, _P, _, _} = M -> ct:fail({got_wrong_down,M})
 2779:     after 5000 -> ?assert(false)
 2780:     end,
 2781:     ok.
 2782: 
 2783: mon_port_down_sig(Config) ->
 2784:     ct:log("By id with immediate reason"),
 2785:     chk_port_down(Config, undefined, bye),
 2786:     ct:log("By id with non-immediate reason"),
 2787:     chk_port_down(Config, undefined, {bye, bye}),
 2788:     ct:log("By name with immediate reason"),
 2789:     chk_port_down(Config, a_port_test_name, bye),
 2790:     ct:log("By name with non-immediate reason"),
 2791:     chk_port_down(Config, another_port_test_name, {bye, bye}),
 2792:     ok.
 2793: 
 2794: chk_port_down(Config, Name, Reason) ->
 2795:     Port = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2796:     true = is_port(Port),
 2797:     {MonWhat, DownItem} = if Name == undefined ->
 2798:                                   {Port, Port};
 2799:                              true ->
 2800:                                   true = register(Name, Port),
 2801:                                   {Name, {Name, node()}}
 2802:                           end,
 2803:     Mon = erlang:monitor(port, MonWhat),
 2804:     unlink(Port),
 2805:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2806:     Proc = spawn(fun () ->
 2807:                          link(Port),
 2808:                          exit(Reason)
 2809:                  end),
 2810:     receive
 2811:         {'DOWN', Mon, Type, Item, ExitReason} ->
 2812:             port = Type,
 2813:             Reason = ExitReason,
 2814:             DownItem = Item
 2815:     end,
 2816:     false = is_process_alive(Proc),
 2817:     ok.
 2818: 
 2819: -ifdef(DISABLED_TESTCASE).
 2820: %% 1. Spawn a port which will sleep 3 seconds
 2821: %% 2. Monitor port
 2822: %% 3. Port driver and dies horribly (via C driver_failure call). This should
 2823: %%    mark port as exiting or something.
 2824: %% 4. While the command happens, a demonitor is requested on the port
 2825: mon_port_driver_die_demonitor(Config) ->
 2826:     erlang:process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 2827: 
 2828:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2829:     ok = load_driver(Path, "sleep_failure_drv"),
 2830:     Port = open_port({spawn, "sleep_failure_drv"}, []),
 2831: 
 2832:     Self = self(),
 2833:     erlang:spawn_opt(
 2834:       fun() ->
 2835:               Ref = erlang:monitor(port, Port),
 2836:               Self ! Ref,
 2837:               timer:sleep(250),
 2838:               erlang:demonitor(Ref),
 2839:               %% Now check that msg still arrives,
 2840:               %% the demon should have arrived after
 2841:               %% the port exited
 2842:               receive
 2843:                   {'DOWN', Ref, _Port2, _, _} = M -> Self ! M
 2844:               after 3000 -> Self ! no_down_message
 2845:               end
 2846:       end,[{scheduler, 2}]),
 2847:     Ref = receive R -> R end,
 2848:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Fail, please!"}},
 2849:     receive
 2850:         {'DOWN', Ref, port, Port, normal} -> ok;
 2851:         {'DOWN', _R, _P, _, _} = M -> ct:fail({got_wrong_down,M})
 2852:     after 5000 -> ?assert(false)
 2853:     end,
 2854:     ok.
 2855: -endif.
 2856: 
 2857: %% @doc Makes a controllable port for testing. Underlying mechanism of this
 2858: %% port is not important, only important is our ability to close/kill it or
 2859: %% have it monitored.
 2860: create_port(Config, Args) ->
 2861:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Config),
 2862:     %% Borrow port test utility from port SUITE
 2863:     Program = filename:join([DataDir, "port_test"]),
 2864:     erlang:open_port({spawn_executable, Program}, [{args, Args}]).
 2865: 
 2866: %% @doc Checks if process Pid exists, and if so, if its monitoring (or not)
 2867: %% the Port (or if port doesn't exist, we assume answer is no).
 2868: port_is_monitored(Pid, Port) when is_pid(Pid), is_port(Port) ->
 2869:     %% Variant for when port is a port id (port())
 2870:     A = case erlang:process_info(Pid, monitors) of
 2871:             undefined -> false;
 2872:             {monitors, ProcMTargets} -> lists:member({port, Port}, ProcMTargets)
 2873:         end,
 2874:     B = case erlang:port_info(Port, monitored_by) of
 2875:             undefined -> false;
 2876:             {monitored_by, PortMonitors} -> lists:member(Pid, PortMonitors)
 2877:         end,
 2878:     {proc_monitors, A, port_monitored_by, B};
 2879: port_is_monitored(Pid, PortName) when is_pid(Pid), is_atom(PortName) ->
 2880:     %% Variant for when port is an atom
 2881:     A = case erlang:process_info(Pid, monitors) of
 2882:         undefined -> false;
 2883:         {monitors, ProcMTargets} ->
 2884:             lists:member({port, {PortName, node()}}, ProcMTargets)
 2885:     end,
 2886:     B = case erlang:whereis(PortName) of
 2887:             undefined -> false; % name is not registered or is dead
 2888:             PortId ->
 2889:                 case erlang:port_info(PortId, monitored_by) of
 2890:                     undefined -> false; % is dead
 2891:                     {monitored_by, PortMonitors} ->
 2892:                         lists:member(Pid, PortMonitors)
 2893:                 end
 2894:         end,
 2895:     {proc_monitors, A, port_monitored_by, B}.
 2896: 
 2897: %%
 2898: %%
 2899: %% Test cases testing for races when an exiting port receives a signal
 2900: %% (port_exit_signal_race group).
 2901: %%
 2902: %%
 2903: 
 2904: -record(esrt, {repeat = 1000,
 2905:                owner_sched = 0,
 2906:                prep_owner = fun (Prt) -> Prt end,
 2907:                post_owner = fun (_) -> ok end,
 2908:                send_sched_start = 0,
 2909:                senders = 1,
 2910:                prep_signal = fun (Prt, PrtOwn) -> {Prt, PrtOwn} end,
 2911:                signal,
 2912:                post_signal = fun (_) -> ok end}).
 2913: 
 2914: port_exit_monitor_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2915:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2916:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PrtOwn}) ->
 2917:                                        {Port, erlang:monitor(port, Port)}
 2918:                                end,
 2919:                       post_signal = fun ({Port, Mon}) ->
 2920:                                             receive
 2921:                                                 {'DOWN', Mon, port, Port, Reason} ->
 2922:                                                     if Reason == noproc -> ok;
 2923:                                                        Reason == normal -> ok;
 2924:                                                        true -> exit({unexpected_reason, Reason})
 2925:                                                     end
 2926:                                             after
 2927:                                                 1000 ->
 2928:                                                     exit(missing_down_message)
 2929:                                             end
 2930:                                     end},
 2931:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2932: 
 2933: port_exit_demonitor_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2934:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2935:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{prep_signal = fun (Port, _PrtOwn) ->
 2936:                                             erlang:monitor(port, Port)
 2937:                                     end,
 2938:                       signal = fun (Mon) ->
 2939:                                        erlang:demonitor(Mon, [flush])
 2940:                                end},
 2941:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2942: 
 2943: port_exit_link_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2944:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2945:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{prep_signal = fun (Port, _PrtOwn) ->
 2946:                                             process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 2947:                                             Port
 2948:                                     end,
 2949:                       signal = fun (Port) ->
 2950:                                        link(Port),
 2951:                                        Port
 2952:                                end,
 2953:                       post_signal = fun (Port) ->
 2954:                                             receive
 2955:                                                 {'EXIT', Port, Reason} ->
 2956:                                                     if Reason == noproc -> ok;
 2957:                                                        Reason == normal -> ok;
 2958:                                                        true -> exit({unexpected_reason, Reason})
 2959:                                                     end
 2960:                                             after
 2961:                                                 1000 ->
 2962:                                                     exit(missing_exit_message)
 2963:                                             end
 2964:                                     end},
 2965:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2966: 
 2967: port_exit_unlink_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2968:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2969:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{prep_signal = fun (Port, _PrtOwn) ->
 2970:                                             process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 2971:                                             link(Port),
 2972:                                             Port
 2973:                                     end,
 2974:                       signal = fun (Port) ->
 2975:                                        unlink(Port),
 2976:                                        Port
 2977:                                end,
 2978:                       post_signal = fun (Port) ->
 2979:                                             receive
 2980:                                                 {'EXIT', Port, Reason} ->
 2981:                                                     if Reason == noproc -> ok;
 2982:                                                        Reason == normal -> ok;
 2983:                                                        true -> exit({unexpected_reason, Reason})
 2984:                                                     end
 2985:                                             after
 2986:                                                 0 ->
 2987:                                                     ok
 2988:                                             end
 2989:                                     end},
 2990:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2991: 
 2992: port_exit_command_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2993:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2994:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 2995:                                        Port ! {PortOwner, {command, "halloj"}},
 2996:                                        Port
 2997:                                end,
 2998:                       post_signal = fun (Port) ->
 2999:                                             receive
 3000:                                                 {Port, Data} ->
 3001:                                                     {data, "halloj"} = Data
 3002:                                             after
 3003:                                                 0 ->
 3004:                                                     ok
 3005:                                             end
 3006:                                     end},
 3007:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3008: 
 3009: port_exit_connect_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3010:     %% We connect the port to the same port owner that it already has
 3011:     %% otherwise we will get badsig issues since the owner close the
 3012:     %% port as itself. The port owner will be spammed by {Port,
 3013:     %% connected} messages but we ignore those...
 3014:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3015:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 3016:                                        Port ! {PortOwner, {connect, PortOwner}},
 3017:                                        Port
 3018:                                end},
 3019:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3020: 
 3021: 
 3022: port_exit_close_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3023:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3024:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 3025:                                        Port ! {PortOwner, close},
 3026:                                        Port
 3027:                                end},
 3028:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3029: 
 3030: port_exit_exit_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3031:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3032:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3033:                                        exit(Port, normal)
 3034:                                end},
 3035:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3036: 
 3037: port_exit_command_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3038:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3039:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3040:                                        true = try
 3041:                                                   erlang:port_command(Port, "hejsan")
 3042:                                               catch
 3043:                                                   error:badarg ->
 3044:                                                       true
 3045:                                               end,
 3046:                                        Port
 3047:                                end,
 3048:                       post_signal = fun (Port) ->
 3049:                                             receive
 3050:                                                 {Port, Data} ->
 3051:                                                     {data, "hejsan"} = Data
 3052:                                             after
 3053:                                                 0 ->
 3054:                                                     ok
 3055:                                             end
 3056:                                     end},
 3057:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3058: 
 3059: port_exit_connect_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3060:     %% We connect the port to the same port owner that it already has
 3061:     %% otherwise we will get badsig issues since the owner close the
 3062:     %% port as itself.
 3063:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3064:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 3065:                                        true = try
 3066:                                                   erlang:port_connect(Port, PortOwner)
 3067:                                               catch
 3068:                                                   error:badarg ->
 3069:                                                       true
 3070:                                               end
 3071:                                end},
 3072:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3073: 
 3074: port_exit_close_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3075:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3076:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3077:                                        true = try
 3078:                                                   erlang:port_close(Port)
 3079:                                               catch
 3080:                                                   error:badarg ->
 3081:                                                       true
 3082:                                               end,
 3083:                                        Port
 3084:                                end},
 3085:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3086: 
 3087: port_exit_control_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3088:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3089:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3090:                                        [] = try
 3091:                                                 erlang:port_control(Port, 0, [])
 3092:                                             catch
 3093:                                                 error:badarg ->
 3094:                                                     []
 3095:                                             end
 3096:                                end},
 3097:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3098: 
 3099: port_exit_call_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3100:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3101:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3102:                                        [] = try
 3103:                                                 erlang:port_call(Port, 0, term_to_binary([]))
 3104:                                             catch
 3105:                                                 error:badarg ->
 3106:                                                     []
 3107:                                             end
 3108:                                end},
 3109:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3110: 
 3111: port_exit_info_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3112:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3113:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 3114:                                        case erlang:port_info(Port, connected) of
 3115:                                            {connected, PortOwner} -> ok;
 3116:                                            undefined -> ok;
 3117:                                            Unexpected -> exit({unexpected_info, Unexpected})
 3118:                                        end
 3119:                                end},
 3120:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3121: 
 3122: 
 3123: prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config) ->
 3124:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 3125:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
 3126:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 3127:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 3128:         1 ->
 3129:             #esrt{};
 3130:         2 ->
 3131:             #esrt{owner_sched = 2,
 3132:                   send_sched_start = 1,
 3133:                   senders = 1};
 3134:         3 ->
 3135:             #esrt{owner_sched = 2,
 3136:                   send_sched_start = 3,
 3137:                   senders = 1};
 3138:         N ->
 3139:             #esrt{owner_sched = 2,
 3140:                   send_sched_start = 3,
 3141:                   senders = N - 3}
 3142:     end.
 3143: 
 3144: repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(#esrt{repeat = N} = ESRT) ->
 3145:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(N, ESRT).
 3146: 
 3147: repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(0, #esrt{}) ->
 3148:     ok;
 3149: repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(N, #esrt{} = ESRT) ->
 3150:     port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT),
 3151:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(N-1, ESRT).
 3152: 
 3153: port_exit_signal_race_test(#esrt{owner_sched = OwnSched,
 3154:                                  prep_owner = PrepOwner,
 3155:                                  post_owner = PostOwner,
 3156:                                  send_sched_start = SendSchedStart,
 3157:                                  senders = Senders,
 3158:                                  prep_signal = PrepSignal,
 3159:                                  signal = Signal,
 3160:                                  post_signal = PostSignal}) ->
 3161:     %% Send a close signal to the port simultaneously as another signal
 3162:     %% is sent (from multiple senders). We try to provoke races between
 3163:     %% the port entering an exiting state and handling of the signal. Such
 3164:     %% races have shown themselves as either stray messages to signal
 3165:     %% sender or runtime system crashes.
 3166:     Parent = self(),
 3167:     {PrtOwn,
 3168:      PrtOwnMon} = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 3169:                                     Prt = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"}, []),
 3170:                                     true = is_port(Prt),
 3171:                                     OwnState = PrepOwner(Prt),
 3172:                                     Prt ! {self(), {command, "hej"}},
 3173:                                     receive
 3174:                                         {Prt, Data} ->
 3175:                                             {data, "hej"} = Data
 3176:                                     end,
 3177:                                     Parent ! {prepared, self(), Prt},
 3178:                                     receive {go, Parent} -> ok end,
 3179:                                     Prt ! {self(), close},
 3180:                                     PostOwner(OwnState)
 3181:                             end,
 3182:                             [link, monitor, {scheduler, OwnSched}]),
 3183:     Port = receive {prepared, PrtOwn, Prt} -> Prt end,
 3184:     PMs = lists:map(fun (SendSched) ->
 3185:                             spawn_opt(fun () ->
 3186:                                               PrtMon = erlang:monitor(port, Port),
 3187:                                               SigState1 = PrepSignal(Port, PrtOwn),
 3188:                                               Parent ! {prepared, self()},
 3189:                                               receive {go, Parent} -> ok end,
 3190:                                               SigState2 = Signal(SigState1),
 3191:                                               receive {'DOWN', PrtMon, port, Port, _} -> ok end,
 3192:                                               receive {bye, Parent} -> ok end,
 3193:                                               PostSignal(SigState2),
 3194:                                               receive Msg -> exit({unexpected_msg, Msg})
 3195:                                               after 0 -> ok
 3196:                                               end
 3197:                                       end,
 3198:                                       [link, monitor, {scheduler, SendSched}])
 3199:                     end,
 3200:                     lists:seq(SendSchedStart, SendSchedStart + Senders - 1)), 
 3201:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, _M}) -> receive {prepared, P} -> ok end end, PMs),
 3202:     PrtOwn ! {go, self()},
 3203:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, _M}) -> P ! {go, self()} end, PMs),
 3204:     receive
 3205:         {'DOWN', PrtOwnMon, process, PrtOwn, OwnReason} ->
 3206:             normal = OwnReason
 3207:     end,
 3208:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, _M}) -> P ! {bye, self()} end, PMs),
 3209:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 3210:                           receive
 3211:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, SigSndReason} ->
 3212:                                   normal = SigSndReason
 3213:                           end
 3214:                   end,
 3215:                   PMs),
 3216:     ok.
 3217: 
 3218: %%
 3219: %%
 3220: %% End of test cases testing for races when an exiting port receives a signal
 3221: %% (port_exit_signal_race group).
 3222: %%
